fields.text:
* Laws Of Substraction *                 -*-muse-*-

Important Descisions
1. What to pursue or ignore
2. What to leave in or eliminate
3. What to do or what to don't

Stupid Things can be Removed Easily
 * excisive
 * confusing
 * wasteful
 * unnatural
 * hazardous
 * hard to use
 * ugly

Doing better with less (not doing more with less)
Subtract the obvious and add the meaningful

Focus is a additive mindset, prioritization is about subtracting

Evaluate everything
 * Keep
 * Increase
 * Start
 * Stop

Laws of substraction
 1. What isn't these matters most
 2. Simplest rules lead to most effective experience
 3. Limiting information engages imagination
 4. Creativity thrives with intellegent constraints
 5. Break it for a breakthrough
 6. Doing something may be worse than doing nothing
fields.title: Laws Of Substraction

* Truth To Live By *                 -*-muse-*-

I desparately need God.

God in loving and compassionate.

I easily deceive myself.

God's will is the very best.

God will be with my in my darkest times and places.

I need other people, especially when I hurt.

Sin destroys happiness.

False gods cannot bring life.

I am worse than I think.

Jesus can redeem every aspect of my life.

The Holy Spirit will give me wisdom, when needed.

Contentment is a spiritual issue.

Peace is not the absence of conflict, but grace to deal with it.

Surrender is the best option.

Transformation takes a lifetime.

Forgiveness is not optional.

God is my security.

God made me for his glory and purpose.

fields.text:
* Ongoing Habits *                 -*-muse-*-

New habits are hard to create and old habits are hard to break. Lord, help me examine my life and
the habits that automatically determine my behavior. Place in me the desire to change habits do not
bring You glory. Without changing my habits it will be difficult for me to grow spiritually.

Here is the process for changing a habit:

    Assessment - Decide that a change is required. If this is really going to happen then I must believe that it is worth the effort.
    Commitment - Create a realistic commitment. Pick something that is doable and sustainable.
    Accountability - Share your commitment with others to create a sense of accountability.
    Plan - Create a plan for tracking the progress for 40 days. If the chain breaks then restart the 40 day timer.
    Reward - Reward compliance for the new habit.
    Celebrate - Celebrate the success.
fields.title: Ongoing Habits

fields.text:
* Personal Log *                 -*-muse-*-

This log is intended to be a personal record of my growth.

**2012-7-8:**

It has been a while since I have spent time is solitude.  The missions conference was the start of a
time of rapid spiritual growth.  I started to realize the importance of setting aside time to be
alone with God.  From December to April I began creating regular habits of daily, weekly, and
quarterly quiet times.

But recently, this time has tapered off.  I have become preoccupied with the concerns of my life and
less focused on the concerns of the kingdom of God.  I really want to recapture this habit and want
to seek God every week.  I need the Spirit speaking to me on a regular basis.

Here is what I would like to commit to:
 * Daily quiet time of 30 minutes
 * Weekly quiet time of 2 hours
 * Quarterly quiet time of 12 hours

During this time one of the challenges that I have is to focus on the Spirit of God and his work in
me.  Many other ideas, concerns, and agendas seem to creep in and take over.  I need to build a
certain amount of structure to support the focus on what God is wanting to do.

See also PrayerPractices
fields.title: Personal Log

fields.text:
* Open SSH *                 -*-muse-*-

By Jonathan Moeller - Last updated: Thursday, October 29, 2009 - Save & Share - 21 Comments

One of Linuxs more useful features is its ability to permit secure, encrypted remote access. Secure
Shell technology (SSH) permits you to control a remote computer without having actual physical
access to the machine. SSHs network traffic is encrypted, and assuming you configure SSH correctly,
quite secure.  Ubuntu Linux has always had strong support for SSH, and Karmic Koala 9.10 is no
different. You can use an SSH implementation called OpenSSH Server to remotely, securely access your
machine.

Heres how to install and perform a basic security configuration of OpenSSH Server on Ubuntu 9.10
Karmic Koala.

First, youll need to install OpenSSH Server. To do so, open up a Terminal window and type the
following command:

sudo apt-get install openssh-server

apt-get will then download and install OpenSSH Server. Depending upon the speed of your computer and
Internet connection, the installation may take several minutes.

Once the installation has finished, return to the Terminal. Well need to make a few changes to your
/etc/ssh/sshd_config file in order to increase SSHs security. First, however, well want to make a
backup copy of your sshd_config file in case anything goes wrong. Type this command into the
Terminal:

sudo cp /etc/ssh/sshd_config ~

This will make a backup copy of the sshd_config file in your home directory.

Next, well need to edit the sshd_config file itself:

sudo gedit /etc/ssh/sshd_config

(Obviously you can use vi or emacs or the editor of your choice instead, though newer Linux users
tend to find gedits GUI easier to use.)

Once youre editing the file, youll want to add the following two directives to the end of the file:

PermitRootLogin no

AllowUsers USERNAME

PermitRootLogin no will block root from logging in via SSH. Its best to never enable root SSH
access, since if an attacker happens to figure out the root password, he or she will have total
remote control over your system.

AllowUsers adds an additional layer of protection by only allowing specific users to connect via
SSH. For instance, if you wanted only users test1 and test2 to have SSH access, you would set
AllowUsers as AllowUsers test1 test2.

You may also want to consider changing the Ports directive. By default SSH runs over TCP/IP port 22,
which means that any malware bot autoscanning port 22 can target it. Changing the Ports directive to
something different will make SSH run over a different, blocking some of those automated cracking
attempts.

Once you have finished changing your settings, save the sshd_config file, and restart the SSH daemon
with this command:

sudo /etc/init.d/ssh restart

You should now be able to SSH into your Ubuntu machine from another system with an SSH client.


See also ComputerSetup
fields.title: Open SSH

fields.text:
* Create Command *                 -*-muse-*-

The reason that Unix rocks, is that it is very easy to create powerful tools by snapping pieces
together.  Think of it as an erector set that can be used to assemble cool things.  Linus did a very
cool thing by making this open to the masses.

The beginning of your automation framework is a single command.  This command is the command you
will use to build every other command you need.  It is like asking the Genie for a thousand wishes
as your first wish.

Create a command called 'cmd-new'.  Put the follow content in it.

    #!/bin/bash
    # Create a new command
    
    name=$b/$1
    cat <<EOF  > $name
    #!/bin/bash
    # $2
    echo $2
    EOF
    
    chmod 755 $name
    e $name

Each time you run this command it will create a new command with name matching the first argument.
It assumes that '$b' points to the directory with your commands.

This script sets the new command to be executable.  Then it runs your text editor on the file.

cmd-new will let you create any new command with about 5 seconds of overhead.  Think about why this
is important.

In the world of programming, abstraction is everything.  It lets you elevate your thinking.  You go
from thinking about how to do something to thinking about the result you want.

Let me illustrate with a simple result.  Type 'cd;du|sort -nr|head' in a terminal.  See what it
does? It finds the ten biggest hogs in your home directory.

Now put that in a command with 

    $ cmd-new showhogs "# Show disk hogs"

Now look at the detailed implementation of the command.  It is very terse.  There is not much typing
saved.  But there is a lot of thinking saved.  Identify the concepts that are used here.

    * Go to home directory
    * Find disk space by visiting recursive directories
    * Use the current directory as a starting point
    * List each directory with a number k-bytes and the directory name
    * Sort this list
    * Use a numeric sort so that 10 > 2
    * Put the big numbers first
    * Only show the first ten
    * List them so I can chain the result

Once this scenario is fully contructed and tested you can immediately forget the details.  Don't try
to remember stuff like this.  Only think about the result that you wish to achieve.  

Later when you need to resuse these tricks, you refer to the script to recall how it was done.  Your
scripts act as your memory.


See also DaysOfLinux
fields.title: Create Command

fields.text:
* Unpaid Overhead *                 -*-muse-*-

When you make this calculation it is important to use the actual
earning power and not the peak earning power.  For example, if you are
a business professional that works 60 hours each week but has 30
billable hours then your earning level is half of the person that is
billing out 30 hours each week with no overhead.

The other common situation is people on salary that are required to
work long hours that are not paid for.  In these cases the actual
hourly earning potential may be half of the stated amount.  This
affects the number of hours you must work in order to pay for other
things that you value.

If you are in either of these situations you may be able to
renegotiate the terms of your work life.  In some cases you may not be
able too, so you learn to live with the reality you are given.


See also [[Budget]]
fields.title: Unpaid Overhead

fields.text:
* Trust *                 -*-muse-*-

I've been thinking a lot recently about what makes for satisfying work. It comes down the central of all values, trust. What I want most is for my clients to trust my motivations, ethics, work process, and technical expertise. At the same time I want to trust my clients with the same things. This should always be the aim with my clients. Can I earn their trust and can they be trusted.

Lord, help me operate each day in a way that creates trust.

fields.text:
* Manuscript Length *                 -*-muse-*-

Write a book in 50 hours (100 pages in 50 days)** working 1 hour/day

300 pages is typical book length.  Commit to 1 hour per day and youre able to write 2 pages per
hour. To write a short book of 100 pages will take 50 days. 100 pages per book/2 pages per hour, or
50 hours.

**250 words per page** is generally considered to be standard. 

ManuscriptLength
This standard was set in earlier times, when most manuscripts were prepared on typewriters with
fixed pitch (monospace) fonts. Even though times have changed, and many more fonts and text options
are now available to the writer, the old guideline of 250 words per page is still the norm.

"Publishers' word count requirements were set up back in the days of typewriters when Courier was
the only option. Therefore, word counts are still based on the standards of 25+ years ago. Most
publishers these days will accept manuscripts in any clear, easily readable font, but there is a
lingering belief among certain authors that only Courier is acceptable for manuscripts...

Many category editors find it easier to judge the length of a book in the way they've always done:
knowing exactly how many book pages a manuscript of, say, 200 pages in Courier at 250 words per page
is going to translate into when it becomes a finished product.

In actuality, however, most editors now accept Times New Roman since it is the 'default' font on
most personal computers. (Also, it saves a tree due to using less paper.) I've also heard from
various authors, via e-mail loops, that they use other fonts. The 'must' is that the font be easy
for an editor to read... IMPORTANT: Whatever font you decide to use, you will need to experiment to
find out how many pages your manuscript would have been if written in Courier, as this is the only
way you will be able to accurately compare your word count to the publishers'...

WHITE SPACE. Manuscripts are counted by page rather than computer word count because authors write
with varying amounts of 'white space'...  It's possible a page with a good deal of narrative might
contain 300+ words, while a page with lots of short dialogue might be not more than 200. Therefore,
the editor has to think in terms of number of pages, not the number of words."

Blair Bancroft: Word Count
http://www.blairbancroft.com/word_count.htm

"Word count: based on 25 lines per page in Courier New 12 pt. averages approximately 250 words per
page. 20 pages, an average chapter, =25,000; 200 pages=50,000; 400 pages=100,000; 600 pages=150,000;
800=200,000 words. Most books are between 50 and 100,000 words long.  Publishers estimate by pages,
including the white space. A computer count of 50,000 words may be 65,000 in publishers' terms. If
you use a computer word count note it on the front of the ms."

Daphne Clair/Laurey Bright: Approaching a publisher  
http://homepages.paradise.net.nz/dclair/approachingeds.html

"Page Counts In most cases, industry standard preferred length is 250 words per page... so a 400
page novel would be at about 100,000 words. If you want to see what size book is selling in your
genre, take a look on the shelves. If the average length is 300 pages, you're looking at a 75,000
word manuscript (approximately)."

Fiction Factor: How Long Should Your Story Be?
http://www.fictionfactor.com/articles/wordcount.html

**manuscript word count** used by editors for counting standard pages (250 words/page)

  1 page       250 words 
100 pages   25,000 words 
200 pages   50,000 words 
300 pages   75,000 words 
500 pages  125,000 words

http://harris-donahue.tripod.com/id4.html


See also PageCount
fields.title: Manuscript Length

Risk = Probability * Damage
Software controls everything

Performance context

**How to test**
What does your system do?
Only test what must work
Scale for risk
Test plan, test cases, test scripts
Concentrate on interfaces
50% goal (testing vs. features)

Record and playback
System under test

*Clarify the context for each role to get greater efficiency.*

 * Watermill code development

**What defines a context?**
    time invested (> 4 hours a week)

fields.text:
* Time To Think *                 -*-muse-*-

Recently I have started a regular habit of writing out ideas and thoughts in the form of
prayers. This have been very productive and useful. I hope to maintain some form of this habit for
the rest of my life.

It is vital to have time set aside on a regular basis for thinking. This is even more essential in
times of change or crisis. We are experiencing a great deal of change now.

The ideal situation would be to spend some time every day in prayer, journaling, reflection,
analysis and reading for development. These five activities can be allocated from the time set aside
daily as a routine. It may work best to have time allocated each day and then select an activity to
do at that time.

See also [[Time]]
fields.title: Time To Think

fields.text:
* Dreams And Fears *                 -*-muse-*-

I recently did an exercise where I listed my five biggest dreams  This is a really excellent thing
to do periodically because it gets you in touch with the things that you care about the most.

You can also do the counterpart exercise by listing your biggest fears.  What makes you lay awake
at night.  I found a surprising result.  There was a large correlation between what I dream for and
what I fear the most.

After working through this list and refining it, I came up with the five things that I care about
the most.  These are my non-negotiables in life.

**Know God**
I want to fully embrace God's truth, freedom, love, and purpose for my life.   If I miss this then
nothing else matters.  Over the years I have watched so many people that I love lose their way.  Not
everyone finishes well, but I want to be one of them.

**Influence others**
I want to influence others by sharing life-changing ideas. The thought of being ineffective or
insignificant drives me to excellence. I measure my legacy by the impact I have on others.

**Successful kids** 
Many areas of life that must all work together for us to be happy and content.  I wish for each of
my children to experience well-being physically, emotionally, spiritually, socially, and mentally.
The possibility that they would be defeated and destroyed in any of these areas is a constant point
of discussion with God.

**Relationships**
I want to belong and be accepted by the people closest to me. I am not content with shallow or
superficial relationships.  I fear that those who know me most will not like me when they truly know
who I am.  This makes it hard for me to be vulnerable to others.

**Security**
I want to be healthy and financially secure.  I fear that some tragedy will destroy everything and
that I will lose it all suddenly.

See also [[Prayer]], KnowingGod, InfluenceOthers, SuccessfulKids, [[Relationships]], [[Security]]
fields.title: Dreams And Fears

fields.text:
* Python - Sending Email *                 -*-muse-*-

How to send email using a Python script

This script works on the Web Faction server

#!/bin/bash
import sys
from smtplib import SMTP

from_addr = 'seaman@comsystem.us'
to_addrs = ['mark.b.seaman@gmail.com']
msg = open('message.txt','r').read()

s = SMTP()
s.connect('smtp.webfaction.com')
s.login('seaman','mds959WF')
s.sendmail(from_addr, to_addrs, msg)


This script is from the Python Org site.

#!/usr/local/bin/python2.6
import smtplib
from email.mime.text import MIMEText

textfile='message.txt'
fp = open(textfile, 'rb')
msg = MIMEText(fp.read())
fp.close()

msg['Subject'] = 'The contents of %s' % textfile
from_addr = 'seaman@comsystem.us'
to_addrs = ['mark.b.seaman@gmail.com']
msg['From'] = from_addr
msg['To'] = to_addrs[0]

s = smtplib.SMTP('smtp.webfaction.com')
s.login('seaman','mds959WF')
s.sendmail(from_addr, to_addrs, msg.as_string())
s.quit()



See also [[FilterMapReduce]]
fields.title: Python - Sending Email

* Featured People *                 -*-muse-*-

During prayer the Lord often brings people to mind.  This practice can
help to take advantage of this nudging.  During prayer I ask God to
remind me of someone that I should pray for.

When someone comes to mind I begin praying for them.  I try to hear
from God what they need from him.  This is a good time to discern what
follow up action I could take.

As part of the prayer time I commit to a single action on their behalf
in the next day.  I write down the experience so that it can be
reviewed as part of the weekly review.

Basic outline of steps:
 * Select
 * Pray
 * Follow up
 * Record
 * Review

See also [[PrayerPractices]], PersonOfInterest

fields.text:
* Mind The Gap *                 -*-muse-*-

How to Survive the Job Search Journey
by Mark Seaman

Your old job has ended but the new one has not yet started.  In fact, there is no job in sight.
What do you do?  How can you process the journey of job search and live to tell the tale? Learn the
tips that will let you have fewer sleepless nights and more peace each day.

I recently found myself in the pool of job seekers.  It felt a little like those grade-B horror
movies where the zombies stagger around looking for some unidentifiable objective.  But in this case
we are looking for meaningful work.  Everything in our life seems hinged on this one goal.

Here are some observations about things that I have learned during my job search.  Hopefully these
ideas will benefit you on your journey.

Mastering the job search puzzle really requires solving four separate puzzles.  Each of these areas
must be resolved for us to feel that we are making progress and positioning ourselves for success.

 * Purpose - we must discover the reason to go to work
 * Path - we must go on an emotional journey and grow personally
 * Process - we must learn the techniques for how to land a job
 * People - we must share the journey with those we trust

Take a few minutes and write out your thoughts about how you are dealing with each of these areas.
Does any area stand out as needing more attention?  If so, focus on this area over the next day.
Identify ways that you might make changes to improve how you feel about it.


* Find Your Purpose

A sense of purpose can be a tricky thing.  But it is absolutely essential to the success of your job
search.  If you aim at nothing you are sure to hit it.

Start by discovering your superpowers. These include your hidden talents or special abilities.  Each
person has a unique personality.  There are no clones.  Your personality gives you a unique
potential that no one else has.  It also disqualifies you from certain things that may come
naturally to others.  Respect your uniqueness and identify the traits that make you special.

Each of us have situations where we know that we will thrive and others where we will die. Over the
next week, keep a list of each time you have been thrilled or drained.  Try to capture at least
five snapshots each day.  Analyze these to find the common threads.  Now imagine constructing a job
environment where you experience all the thrills and avoid all the drains.  What does this teach you
about your job search?

Your life has been a unique experience.  No one else has had your same a assets or liabilities.
Make a list of these things in order to identify how to leverage them to get your perfect job.  Your
actions to get the job should be customized to your special personality.  Leverage what you have in
order to get the greatest gain.

An employer, client, or customer is only asking one question.   "Do you bring more value than you
cost?"  Find creative ways to answer this question in their minds.  If you do, then you may not even
have to interview.  A demonstration of the value that you bring is much more important than what
your resume says.  Attempt to win the job before the race even starts.

Attend events where you know your prospective employers hang out.  Show them that you can be the one
to solve their problems.  This will make you the one indispensible choice for the position that you
want. Create your own dream job.


* Find Your Path

Change affect all of us in profound ways.  Use the stress of a job search to grow personally.
Understanding the stages that the transition will bring will help to minimize the discomfort that we
feel. Pain is inevitable but growth is optional. By recognizing the stages of change we can know
when we need courage to act or acceptance for things that are outside of our control.

Ending is the first stage in the emotional journey of job search.  We must identify the loss of
whatever the old job offered us.  We need to be able to understand the loss to celebrate the good
things that we enjoyed.  Then we can truly accept the reality and mourn the loss with friends.

The gap between the ending and the beginning is a time of turmoil.  This period is a tunnel of chaos
where anything can happen.  We have times when all hope is gone.  Each time there is a glimmer we
put all of our hope on that one thing.  Then when it collapses we feel crushed.  This is a time to
focus on the important task of growing emotionally so that our confidence is based on something more
than the last conversation that we had.  Involve others close to you.  Draw encouragement from them.

The new beginning starts when we choose to get off the emotional roller-coaster.  This may be long
before we actually get a job.  It starts when we feel a solid foundation.  At that point we know
that the external situation will be faced with restored confidence.

Eventually you will receive the fullfillment of your goals by getting the new job.  But the critical
battle is fought internally with our own fears.  This is a critical time when we need others to draw
close and surround us with their love.  We are always better together.  Don't face these challenges alone.


* Find Your Process

The standard process for getting a job is completely broken for most people.  You may want to try to
create your own process, at least as a part of your overall job search strategy.  Consider the
following instructions for ninja job search.

Create a list of 40 companies you want to consider. Spent 40 minutes, building four different
lists. List companies you have already been thinking about (in 10 minutes).  Use indeed.com to
search for opennings in your field (in 10 minutes).  Don't visit the details, just locate the
openings. List people you know where you would like their job. Search for companies in the news
using Google.  Spend 10 minutes on each list and have your top-40 in forty minutes.

Turn your list of 40 companies into a table.  Columns include: Company, Contact(y/n), Postings(y/n),
Excited.  Use indeed.com to find out if the company is hiring people like you.  You ninja strategy
is to skip the application process in favor of getting to know an insider. You will research each
company enough to learn if it is a good fit for you.

Your contact inside the company is your most important source of information about the company.
They are also your most critical ally. Locate an advocate that will help you understand the hiring
process and ask for an informational interview.

Use what you learn to reprioritize your list of companies.  Make sure to follow up on all of the
leads generated through the process and to thank everyone who will spend time with you.  Rearrange
your schedule to put you in contact with as many people as possible and look for opportunities to
connect with others.

How excited you feel about a particular company is the most important indicator of the motivation
that you have to pursue them. Start with the company that you are most excited about, and work your
way down.  You have a deep bench but you will probably generate a job in the first 10-15 companies
that you work on.

Send email to people that you have not met in order to get an informational interview.  Seek out
another contact if the first does not respond in three days. Repeat this overall process until you
get hired.  For more details on the process read, "2-hour Job Search".  Easy read and great ideas
for all of the steps.


* Find Your People

A job search is an excellent time to deepen connections with others.  You may be more open than at
any other time to both give and receive from others.   If you are a skilled professional you may
still be a novice job seeker.   This may be a newly found area of incompetence.  Others can help you
with advice and encouragement that you need.

Consider finding a mentor that can speak to you about the things that you need to hear. Also find
ways that you can mentor others with insights that you have.  Both of these relationships are built
on trust and you will need that connection during this time.  It is also great to develop your
relationships with peers that you can get an objective view from.  Join a support group to work
through possibilities for companies together.

Beef up you professional network using modern tools like Linked In, and Meetup.com.  Become active
in your professional organizations as well as job search groups.  This is no time to sit at home.
It is a time to be around people as much as possible.

Volunteer your time by looking for opportunities to serve that also have a strategic benefit for
you. Use the time to learn a new skill or refresh old ones. Look for a creative break-through while
you have a community presence.  Always keep an attitude of service to others.

This is time to create a deeper connection with those around you. Trust is built by people taking
risks and having those rewarded.  Be willing to take for risks with your support network.  Share
deeper things and be willing to be vulnerable.  Your trust will almost certainly be reciprocated.

Pass on what you know and learn what others know.  We are always better together.
fields.title: Mind The Gap

**pycon - day 1**

The Python Conference is being held this year in Santa Clara, California.  This is the first time
that I have been able to attend Pycon.  It is very exciting to be interacting with so many fantastic
people.

**Pyramid Tutorial**

I attended a four-hour tutorial on Pyramid, which is a Python framework, with the goal of building
small web applications quickly that can scale into complex applications.  Many frameworks are good
at either but not both.

During the tutorial we installed all of the tools, learned about the technology, and built a simple
web application.  I can now use this to build other apps.

**Effective Django**

This tutorial assumed the ability to build simple applications.   It dealt with all of the issues
that porfessional developers need to build apps successfully.

It gave a set of best practices, many of which I was already using, but several I was not.   The key
insights that were gained, included use of Selenium for testing of the UI, and Class Based Views
that allow for greater code resue in the UI front-end.

_____________________________________________________________________________

**pycon - day 2**

**Test-Driven Django**

This tutorial covered the tools and techniques for doing test driven development with a Django
application.  It covered both how to do effective unit testing and functional testing.  We set up
Selenium to both control and test the page elements that the web browser will see.  I will be using
all of these techniques on all current and future projects.

**Heroku**

Heroku is a web deployment platform that takes all of the pain out of deployment.  It is a PaaS
(platform as a service).  During this workshop we learned about the 12 factors that affect web
deployment (http://12factor.net).  

We then built and deployed a web application using the following recipe
(http://pycon-tutorial.herokuapp.com).  This process can be repeated in less than five minutes.
Heroku provides a free service that can support a hobby job, but also scales to extremely large
systems.  It is not the cheapest service (considering only fees), but probably the cheapest (if you
value your time). This is going to be my main deployment engine moving forward.

**Wiring Django Packages**

This session dealt with all of the issues of package usage, installation, deployment, and creation.
I missed most of this session due to the Heroku session.  The notes are at http://bit.ly/WDP2013

**Tools**

Getting working installations of virtualenv, selenium, and heroku was worth the cost of the entire
conference.  I can go home now...

... but wait there's more.
 
_____________________________________________________________________________

**pycon - day 3**

The first two days were tutorial sessions.  The regular conference sessions spanned the next three
days.  The conference attendance what 2500 and the largest that the organizers want it to be.  This
is to have the maximum opportunity to foster the community spirit of "people helping people".

**Raspberry Pi**

Eben Upton spoke from Cambridge about the need to foster a hacker ethic.  Cambridge has seen a
constant erosion in the number of qualified applications to the computer science program.  Eben was
given the task of revitalizing interest in working with computers by producing low-cost hardware
that invites students to program.  Today's systems are built for users and discourage programming.
Their solution was the Rasperry Pi, a $35 computer board that has enough capability for almost any
hobbiest project.  The response to the product has exceeded everyone's expectations.  We were all
given a Raspberry Pi and told to build something cool.

There was also a lot of discussion about ways to work in communities and schools to foster interest
in computers and programming.  I am very interested in this subject and would like to work with
others on doing something in our community.

**Naming of Ducks**

This talk dealt with the best pracitices for naming functions, classes, and variables within Python
programs.  This is even more important in a language that does not enforce the variable types to be
designated as a they are used.

**Exceptions**

Bruce Eckel gave a talk on best practices with exception handling in Python.  He discussed how
exceptions in Python differ for other lanugages like Java and C++.

**Kivy**

Kivy is a GUI toolkit that is great for mobile applications.  It supports non-traditional input
devices like multi-touch and Leap Motion.  Visit Kivy.org to learn more about using the toolkit for
your apps.

**Python 3.3**

Why do you want to upgrade from 2.7 to 3.3?  There are many small features that can save effort.
I'm looking at switching my work to Python 3.3.   Now with virtualenv in place it should be fairly
easy to move forward.

**Five minute to deploy (using PaaS)**

This talk discussed the different services available for hosting web apps.  It made the argument
that for most small shops (without a large IT staff), you need to get the highest possible value
from your service provider.  He then gave a comparison of six different PaaS (Platform as a service)
providers. We gave a demo of a deployment on Heroku that took five minutes.



See also PyCon,  [[~/pycon/]], BizPortal

fields.text:
* Django Database Tables *                 -*-muse-*-

There are several essential methods needed for each data type within
Django.  In order to create a new data type, each of the following
operations should be implemented in a standardized way:

 * to_str - convert from a list of fields into a text string
 * parse  - convert from a string into the object fields
 * set_values - assign the fields of the orject
 * get_values - return the fields of the object as a list

 * create - create a new object unless there is already one
 * update - write the data into a record in the database
 * get    - get the matching record
 * query  - return a list of matching records
 * delete - delete the matching record

See also [[Brain]]

fields.text:
* Mentors *                 -*-muse-*-

Mentors are positive people by definition. It takes a positive person to give of himself or herself
to help another learn, grow and succeed.

Here are the characteristics of a good MENTOR

MENTOR: Someone whose hindsight can become your foresight.

Were willing to share their wisdom, knowledge, skills and expertise.  

Had a positive outlook on life. They helped me through tough times and showed me how to find the
opportunity in the difficulties I was facing.

Were genuinely concerned about me and my success.  In addition to being knowledgeable, they were
empathetic.

Really knew what they were doing.  I respected them for their knowledge and skills.  

Kept growing themselves. All of my mentors were curious and inquisitive. Sometimes the roles were
reversed. They asked what I was reading, and then read the books themselves  so they could learn
and we could discuss the ideas.

Gave me direct, constructive feedback. They held me to high standards. They congratulated me when I
met their expectations. They corrected me when I failed to do so  but in a manner where I learned
what not to do the next time.

Were respected by their colleagues. Choosing someone who is highly regarded in his or her field or
company is one of the best ways to identify a mentor.

Sought out and valued the opinions of others. My best mentor always told me to listen most carefully
to the people with whom I disagreed  in that way I might learn something. And, he was right.
fields.title: Mentors

Seed list       (list of categories of files to expand)

Enumerate       (a table of files for presentation in CSV format)

File list       (actual paths to all files to present)

Index           (directory of directories of files)

JS objects      (nested list of file contents)

JSON            (string representation of file content)

Page            (angular template of data content)

fields.text:
* Highlights *                 -*-muse-*-

High = How I most felt God's love for me today.     What was the biggest blessing?
Low  = When I felt most isolated from God today.    What was the biggest disappointment?
___________________________________________________________________________________________________

12-7
Low: I worked for $8,150 in October that I will probably not get paid for.  This is going to really
hurt us financially.

12-3
Low: December is my least favorite month.  Conflict is increased between Stacie and I and there are a
lot  of feelings of disappointment and disillisionment.

Low: Josiah is beginning to struggle physically.  He was good for a while but now he is doing
poorly.

High: Cassandriel is so beautiful.  She is a precious gift from God.

Low: Josiah does not spend his time in the way that I think he should.

Low:  I fear that Christine will never be able to support herself.  Christine has been working for
Eric.  But she is now looking for work again.

High: Our trip to Jordan has given me a lot to think about.  I feel that God is calling me to invest
in building a true and valuable partnership.

8-25

High: Hope that I can find contract work in my areas of strength.  I have a meeting set up for
tomorrow to discuss jobs with Core Software Group.

Low: The job search process has been really stressfull.  I have invested around 140 hours of work in
looking for employment.

High: God has been showing me many things about the spiritual impact of my job search.  Many of
these lessons are things that could be shared with others.

High: Two weeks ago Josiah visited a chiropracter that had a dramatic impact on him.  He said that
he was feeling like he had woken from a coma.  Thank you Lord for your mercy and grace in this
matter. We ask for continued progress.

High: I met a new friend at NoCoNet and was able to be an encouragement to him.

High:  It has been a real blessing to have Marshall around.  Last week the 'guys' launched their
company, New Line Technical Innovations.

8-16

Low: I totally misplanned the testing presentation for the Software Architects Group.  I was trying
to boil the ocean.  The meeting was six hours away, and I didn't have a presentation that would
work.  I had been up all night after scrapping my presentation.

High: The presentation went well and we had eight new people at the meeting.  I was able to
communicate the essential ideas and Josiah was there to share the experience with me.

8-10

High: The joy of putting together the Test-Driven Architecture talk.

Low: Many frustrations of working with watermill are caused by neglect.

Low: A week ago I got a thorn in my finger and it still hurts.

8-1

High: Discovered Otterbox as a possible place to work.  They have the same values that I have. High
quality products, high trust relationships, and desire to make a difference.

High: The Lord has provided wonderfully for me so far, and it gives me confidence for the future.

High: God has work selected for me, and he will guide me to it.

Low: Fear over the future sometimes creeps in and colors my thinking. NO FEAR except FEAR.

7-29 

High: Celebrating Jennifer Nardin's birthday was fun.  We went to the Chimney Park Bistro.  

High: Josiah had an EEG that recorded data that may help to solve his neuro issues.

High: I have created a marketing plan and hope to spend 2 hours daily on implementing it. 

Low: I get so  discouraged over Josiah's situation. 

Low: The shooting in the movie theatre created so much  suffering for so many people. 

7-24 

High: OSCON gave me a chance to process thoughts about my career.  I feel like I know which  
direction I should go next. 

Low: I have a lot of anxiety about my next career steps.  There are so  many possibilities and I 
don't want to misstep. 

Low: Stacie's back is getting steadily worse each  year.  I worry about the impact on her overall 
health. 

High: I was able to meet with Chris Fornof  and speak to him about lifestyle issues. 

7-14 

High: Today is Stacie's party. I want to bless her with a great time. 

High: I reworked my  resume, which felt good to see all that I had accomplished. 

High: Tomorrow I leave for OSCON. 

Low: I  am overwhelmed by a feeling that I should be doing many different things for SWS but do not 
the  time. 

7-13 

Low:  I worry that I will not be able to find a job because it requires a sales focus. 

7-11 

High: Business forum allowed me to meet people and made me feel optimistic. 

High: Morning time  with God 

7-12 

High: Meet with Kohls and Olmsteads 

High: Pipescan recorder made rapid progress 

T, 7-10 

High: Encouragent from Tim. He has a lot of insight and is able to get me to expand my  thinking. 

High: The blessing and peace of enjoying God in the morning on the back deck. 

Low: Josiah  has not been able to get much help from the doctors. 

Su, 7-8 

High: Rachel's visit was a real encouragement.  It was wonderful to see how much she had  grown. 

Low: Josiah's neurological problems.  Josiah has not been himself for two months now.  He has  taken 
a leave of absence from school. 

High: Excitement over possible future engineering work. There  are so many interesting possibilities 
for the future. 

Low: I am frightened of not being able to find  work and running out of money. 

Low: I am worried that I will not be able to create demand because of  my marketing disability. 

Low: I put a lot of effort into creating things that no one cares about.  High: God has always 
provided for us in the past (sometimes in unexpected ways). 

Su, 5-6 

High: I was able to encourage Kevin Burke in his job transition.  He just found out that his  job is 
ending and that he will have to do something new. 

F, 5-4 

Low: I had great difficulty going to sleep due to fear of public speaking.  I a experiencing  a lot 
of anxiety tied to a fear of failure in teaching.  I believe that this is largely  psychological and 
spiritual warfare. 

W, 5-2 

High: Learned about traning companies. For the first time, I can see a way to build the  future that 
I most want to live. 

W, 4-25 

High: I had a blast creating an outline for a class on software development skills.  It  gives me  
hope that I could find work as my Watermill project wraps up. 

Low: I feel so lustful  sometimes.  My brain just clicks into some bad mode and I feel powerless  
against it. 

T, 4-17 

High: I found a direct way to read and write millcmd values.  I love inventing new things. 

M, 4-16 

High: Excited about new job possibilities.  As Watermill ends, I am looking forward to new   
possibilities. 

Low: I am afraid of not finding suitable work.  It is very unsettling to not be able  to picture the 
 future. 

F, 04-13 

High: I taught Bryan and Josiah about file management.  My purpose in life has something  to do with 
 teaching young adults. 

W, 04-11 

High: Great meeting with Eric lasted for five hours.  I connect with him on so many  different 
levels. 

High: Set up the Ultrabook with everything that is needed. 

T, 04-10 

Low: Series of cutbacks at Watermill make the current situation undesireable.  I finally  made a  
decision to terminate my involvement with Watermill. 

Th, 04-05 

High: Purchased an Ultrabook for my next computer. 

F, 03-30 

Low: Support Center was broken due to changes that I made. I spent half of my day off  trying to get 
 things running. 

High: It was great to talk with Rachel.  She was in Taiwan last week  and had a great time.  She is  
very involved with the church in Aira. 

Th, 03-29 

Low: Watermill has been very demanding.  No matter how much effort I put in I don't feel  like I can 
 meet the need.  During last minute testing I found that the collections switch has never  worked. 

High: I have been looking forward to time alone with you, God.  I need to spend time in  your 
presence. 

W, 03-27 

Low: Stacie is experiencing a great deal of frustration and uncertainty at work.  The  Banner  
management has begun taking insane cost saving measures.  People are feeling very uncertain  about  
their futures. 

M, 03-26 

Low: This past week has been short on time alone with God.  I have let other activities  crowd that  
out.  I would like to get back on track. 

Su, 03-25 

High: We had a wonderful time going to Taverna with the Narins and Deeners after church. 

S, 03-24 

High: We had a great time with our home group sharing about Ignite the fire. 

F, 03-23 

High: Fitzsimons baby was born.  What a blessing.  I am so happy for them. 

High: Work  with Josiah on programming project.  It is such a blessing to collaborate with my son  
as a peer.   High: Rachel is having a great time in Taiwan.  I am so happy that she can have such 
wonderful   experiences.

High: I was able to get fully automatic tests to run on Support Center. 

T, 03-20 

High: I had an opportunity to share the vision and show public encoragement in a info  meeting for  
ignite the fire. 

High: We brought on two new field mills without any problems. 

M, 03-19 

Low: Don expressed disappointment over the deployment of the first two new field units.   It  
reminds me of how much of a gap there is in expectations.  It demonstrates how my current job  does

S, 03-03 

High: After a couple of months I finally arrived at a life budget that feels like it fits   
perfectly.

Low: Joisah broke his arm snowboarding.  He also appears to be struggling in school.   Low: Rachel

High: Josiah and Sam are going to have a child. Thank you Lord.  Please protect them.

High: Discussions with Joisah and Rachel.  They are both interesting people with wonderful   ideas.  
I am so grateful for how you are moving in both of their lives. 

Low: Conflict over  priorities and practices at Watermill.

High: Tim Musslewhite has met with me for the last couple of months.

Su, 11-13

Low: Lustful feelings.  I don't know how to supress these desires.

 It felt very nice.

10-13

Low: Tearing my shoe - I felt frustrated and victimized, and vulnerable.  I  expected you to protect 
me, and felt exposed to Satan's attack.

fields.text:
* Bit Rot Concepts *                 -*-muse-*-

_____________________________________________________________________________

**50 Tricks for Testing (Finding the path for Harmonious Development)**

Motto:  Understanding is a journey,  pass on what you know.
        Give more than you get.

Why the title? Building a structure for advanced testing

Two types of knowledge: Engineering, Technology

**Stages of Acceptance**
New ideas are hard to accept because they challenge the staus quo.

**Stages of Acceptance**
Denial      - That's not new, we already do it that way
Bargaining  - That will never work
Acceptance  - This new approach could improve our situation

**Four-stroke Engine** -- roles of programming
Test entire system frequently
Fix every known problem
Improve the structure in small steps
Extend the functionality by adding new features

**My Heroes**
Met a lot of famous people
My heroes see themselves as a part of a a larger story
Great work is done when we want to make the world better

**Multiple roles must be balanced**
Take turns at different roles
Many programmers don't understand the roles
The issue is not just can you get the feature working, but how it impacts the system
Sequence Test, Fix, Improve, Extend
Complete all strokes on one task
Each step is built on the others
Testing is the fundamental skill in programming

**Technical Debt** -- measure in hours
Test          - Unknown defects
Fix           - Defects
Improve       - Complexity, Fragile
Functionality - Needed features
Pay off a little debt each day
Resigned to bankruptcy?

**How to Test** 
Testing is: 1. Defining execution context, 2. Defining the expected results
Three levels - Simple(Stupid easy), Medium(Realistic), Hard(Sophisticated)
System test/unit test
Do what's easy
    "We cannot test because it is hard"
    "We have monkey do"
    ... then make everything else easy
Eliminate gratititous complexity!

**Dreyfus model**
novice, Beginner,Competent, Proficient, Expert

In the next hour I'm going to demonstrate how a new approach to testing.

Build all of your test knowledge into an executable script.

**Principles**
 * Build your own tools
 * Say it in code 
 * Write tests first
 * Constantly refactor
 * Build a catalog of tricks

**Assets to leave behind**
 * Product code
 * Test library
 * General domain library
 * Tools

**Test Environments**
Everything must be automatic (decide/do)
Tools must do the task they are needed for
Production, Staging, Development
Essential tasks: Demote, Promote, Test, Changes, Commit

**System Test** -- Ensure the story works
High level test that uses the entire system
Test with real data or test data

Run
    dna-scan > dna-scan.out 
Compare
    diff dna-scan.out dna-scan.correct
Expect
    cp dna-scan.out dna-scan.correct

**Unit Test** -- Ensure the function works
Isolate a single function to test

Run
    x = dna-scan() 
Compare
    assert(x,'This better work')
Expect
    x = 'This works now'


See also BitRotStrategy

Journal thoughts to better hear from God.  What is on your mind God?

My identity in not based on my effort.

Matt 6:33 - Pursue my leadership as your top priority.  Everything else is a lot less important.  I
will orchestrate all of the details of your life as you totally trust me.  Worry about the present
not the future or the past. I will provide for your every need.

Consider my plan for you life.  This is the ultimate key to your happiness and fulfillment.  As much
as you strive you can never build the world that you most desire.

Let me guide your decisions.  Allow me to change what you love.  Then you will have the perfect life
that I intended for you.

Fulfilling my purpose is your ultimate destiny.  It is your path to fulfillment.  True joy is found
when you follow me.

At times you will find yourself aligned with others.  But sometimes you will walk alone.Often
circumstances will be easy, but there will also be hard times that will test your faith.

I will guide you through good times and bad.  Wholeheartedly pursue my plans for your life.  Let me
have my way and things will work out much better.

The bigged dreams that you have are placed there by me.   Let my Spirit guide you toward their
fulfillment. 

Set aside time to listen for my direction.   Let me love you.  Receive my love and acceptance for
you.  Pass it on to others.

**Lasting impressions**
Life is fleeting; time passes quickly
The big issues of today may not be important later
I am called to influence young adults
Writing is a critical part of my purpose
Recalling the past brings sadness
Disappointment is a result of unfulfilled dreams
What we do with people matters most
God is in control of our lives
I need to slow down and listen to God more
I can have influence with others
Follow up where the response is positive
Hearing and responding to God is always good


See also PrayerPractices, RestCycle, PrayerPrompting, [[Highlights]]
fields.title: Personal Retreat 2012-03-31

fields.text:
* Knowing God *                 -*-muse-*-

I want to fully embrace God's truth, freedom, love, and purpose for my life.   If I miss this then
nothing else matters.  Over the years I have watched so many people that I love lose their way.  Not
everyone finishes well, but I want to be one of them.

The secret to finishing well may be to understand what is really at stake.  This produces an
appreciation of the challenges to truly following God.  

Consider the people that you have known that are over fifty and still following God.  These folks
are in it to the finish line.  Throughout life there are many opportunities to give up along the
way.

Have great respect for the people that go the distance.  Spend time with them.  Learn their
secrets of longevity.  We all need people to inspire us.  We also need examples to copy.

At the end of your life, be remembered as a friend of God.  Make this your goal.  Everything else
pails in comparison.  What profit is there if you gain the whole world and lose your soul in the
process.

Commit time to pursuing God and his agenda.  Look for opportunities to grow and deepen in your
relationship with him.  Allow the Spirit to speak clearly and act on your best understanding. Say
'Yes' before you know the question.

Remove the barriers that separate you from following Jesus.  Repent from sin.  Be aware of the role
that fear plays in your life.  Grow a deeper level of trust daily.


See also [[PrayerPractices]], DreamsAndFears
fields.title: Knowing God

fields.text:
* Talent Themes *                 -*-muse-*-

According to the Strengths Finder I have five talent themes.
 * Achiever
 * Focus
 * Learner
 * Input
 * Ideation

I am driven to achieve highly focused results that I believe are important and have a constant need
to learn and solve problems.

Every talent theme can be both a blessing and a challenge. It represents an opportunity for
excellence and also a propensity to have chronic problems of a certain type.

Lord help me to use these personality traits that You have given me for their constructive purpose.
Help me to bring glory to You through how You have made me.  Please help me to avoid the pitfalls of
being driven to the point of obsession or focusing on the wrong things.

See also ProgressModel

fields.text:
* Stable Operating Points *                 -*-muse-*-

A model for sustainable growth is based on a series of stable operating points.

Each operating point is based on the number of people involved with the company 1, 2, 3, 5, 8, 13
people limit growth to one step every six months

1.  solo software consultant
2.  master and apprentice
3.  marketing, junior and senior developer
5.  business, marketing, small development team (3)
8.  business, marketing, development team (6)
13. business team (3), two development teams (10)

Grow business and workers together.

Take on one new client for every worker

Grow business first then add workers

Establish sustainable business practices before adding new people

See also [[Business]]
fields.title: Stable Operating Points

fields.text:
* Pastors Conference *                 -*-muse-*-

**All In**
All In has no shelf life (you must choose every day).
How to stay all-in
 * keep telling stories
 * Complete integrity in life and reporting
 * Embrace theology of both sucess and failure
 * Stay in the field of harvest (by looking for the lost and the least)
 * Endure through the desert times (when there is no sustenance or refreshing)
 * Train those who are younger

**Cross Cultural Interaction**
1. Get together and see the other
2. Go be with people you would not normally be with
3. Aknowledge blind spots
4. Examine the outcomes vs. intentions
5. Get involved in cross cultural ministry

**Spiritual Formation**
What is the end goal of spiritual formation? Know Christ, Be like Jesus, Fruit, One with God
Ministry is to reflect God's glory in us
What goal is demostrated in your church by its activities?
Stages of change (pre-cog, cognition, readiness, preparation, action, abandonment or maintenance)
Formation occurs in all dimensions, contexts, seasons of life
Critial Journey
God's activity - grace, bible, Spirit
We need to help others process the pain
We need to find ways to form relationships to aid in spiritual formation 
Seminiaries teach theology & skills
Churches teach ministry, bible, & leadership
We need to focus on well-being
Living in God's purpose and presence
Receiving love is the foundation of true spiritual formation
Cultural barriers to formation:
 * Cynicism about truth
 * Consumerism
 * Individualism
 * Digitization 'The Shallows' Nick Carr
Every age has its own evil
Emotions are a window into our soul
Grace to see:
 * Mind (our mental self) thoughts
 * Heart (our emontional self) feelings -- Theology below the neck
 * Body (our physical self) health
 * Longings (our deepest desires) hopes & dreams
Short declarative statements:
 * I have been thinking a lot recently about ...
 * I have been feeling ...
 * Energy, illness, sleep, stress
 * What are my dreams and fears
Look at the true self rather than the idealized version of me
Read and review 
What is God's invitation.
http://sacredspace.ie

**Wisdom**
Wisdom is not the same as being smart
We need more than cleverness
The rules don't cover most situations
We need more than just rules for navigation
Wisdom is not about intellect
Wise people make wise decisions (positive feedback cycle)
We have a responsibility to receive and pass on wisdom
Older people are more flexible in their thinking
Practice double listening (world & God)
Right foot/left foot ... no quick answers
Dog's tail on a cat
Wisdom defines both the path and the destination
The destination is the current path extended indefinitely
Your fears show what you love most



See also PrayerPractices
fields.title: Pastors Conference

fields.text:
* Wm Event Pattern *                 -*-muse-*-

The Event class can be used in place of the Message mechanism for allowing two processes to
communicate with each other.  This change can be done mechanically by following these simple steps:

 * identify set of vars/message to replace

 * add new vars to data/vars.mc

 * add events to header

 * create events in constructor

 * add event handlers to run

 * add tests to set and recieve events

 * hook message handler to event

 * trigger event in caller

 * replace all tests with vars

 * remove old handler

 * remove MessageType


See also WmProjects
fields.title: Wm Event Pattern

fields.text:
* Prayer Journal *                 -*-muse-*-

**Guidelines**
Keep private and be brutally honest
Write out concerns as a prayer
Listen to God
Review at quarterly retreat
___________________________________________________________________________________________________

**Josiah & Sam** - Feb 2011

There is so much going on in their lives right now.  I ask that you would watch over Josiah and
Sam.  Keep them secure in your plan.  Let them focus on the important issues of life in front of
them and help them to understand how to have a sustainable lifestyle.

Thank you for what you have done in both of their lives.  Thank you for the blessing that they have
become to Stacie and me. We have been able to see your grace operating within them, to bring them to
the point they are at now. We know that you will continue to be faithful to them.

God, bless and preserve their health. Restore Josiah's broken arm to its full strength. Help Sam to
feel better and the baby to grow and thrive.  Bring relief to Josiah from the migraines he struggles
with. 

Protect them from any financial tragedy from not having insurance. Allow Josiah and Sam to move into
their new home in Loveland, even though Josiah has a broken arm.

Help Josiah to concentrate enough on his school work to be sucessful.  Give him the ability to pass
the prelim assignment so that he can begin serious work on his thesis.

Let the fullness of your love surround them.  Let your plan for their lives be fully accomplished in
them. Bring glory to yourself through their lives.  May your kingdom be demonstrated in them.
___________________________________________________________________________________________________

**Marriage Improvement** - Jan 2011

Stacie and I have a wonderful marriage.  But I am regularly blindsided by the issues that linger
unresolved for years. We need a way to identify the emotional needs that drive each of us and
negotiate how they can be met.  We need a plan for regular work on our marriage.

It is easy for me to assume that Stacie is just like me.  This is a very flawed assumption based on
her many similarities.  We still have many areas where our fundamental assumptions  about things are
different. This could actually be a strength for us, if we learn to honor those differences.

Lord show us where to start.  Help us begin a deeper journey to connect with each other.  I want you
to be at the center of our relationship.  Draw us closer together.

I confess that I consistantly demand my own selfish way and neglect to look at things from Stacie's
viewpoint.  I often ignore her needs, while carefully guarding and cultivating my own. Grant me both
the desire and power to change.

Give us a means of talking about these issues that is constructive and life-giving.  Make us one in
spirit and purpose.  Cause us to fall in love all over again.
___________________________________________________________________________________________________

**Christmas Blues** - Dec 2011

I recently realized that December is a really tough month for me.  Stacie's expectations create a
great deal of anxiety in me.  The natural differences that we have seem to be accentuated during
this time of year.  Conflict is at a annual high, during this season of good will.

I don't enjoy the same activities as Stacie, and this creates tension in our relationship.  There
are high expectations for social activities and conflict over how to spend money.  I always feel
like a reluctant participant in these activities. Then I feel guilty for not wanting to take part or
for not enjoying it like I should.

I feel bullied and like a second rate person who can't appreciate the true meaning of Christmas.
Stacie frequently compares me to members of my family that I know that she does not respect.  I
can't wait for January to get here when I can get back to normal.

It is strange to have our anniversary at this time of year.  Maybe it is good timing to pause and
reflect about the true nature of our relationship when we are feeling so raw and exposed.

Lord, help me to see this time of year through your eyes.  Help me to embrace the brokenness that I
feel rather than simply hide from it.  Help me to be kind and loving even when I don't want to be.
Show me how to resolve my own personal issues without driving others crazy.
___________________________________________________________________________________________________

**Concern for Christine** - Nov 2011

Christine has not developed in her personal life.  She is smart enough, but completely disabled
emotionally.  It is likely that she will never be able to care for herself or have meaningful
relationships with others. She lacks motivation, confidence, and hope for the future.  I have no
idea how to help her.  Communication about these subjects is completely fruitless and frustrating.

Lord give me courage to even look at this area of my life.  I am so frustrated about it that I
systematically avoid all thinking about it.  I completely shutdown emotionally because I feel so
helpless.

Help me to see Christine as you see her.  I know that you have placed her in our family on purpose.
She plays a role in our lives and we play a role in hers.  Please give me more understanding about
what that role is.

If I will ever be able to play a part in helping her I must first embrace your presence in this area
of my life. Transform my heart and mind.  Give me you insights so that I can be changed at the core.
__________________________________________________________________________________________________


See also PrayerPractices
fields.title: Prayer Journal

fields.text:
* Annual Time Spent *                 -*-muse-*-

**Next 12 months**

Start by defining the scope of your budget.  One year is a good
timeframe to consider.  This works great because you can always
consider the end of this budget cycle to be one year from now.

**Discretionary Time**

Of the 24 hours each day you should remove at least 10 for sleeping
and getting ready.  Of the total 5000 hours, 2000 are typically spent
at your basic job.  If you work 60 hours each week this jumps to
3000. This kind of an investment is a choice that you can make. 

Most people spend a couple of hours each day eating and getting to
work.  This is about 500 hours in a year.

**Leisure Time**

I like to spend around ten hours each week doing things with my
family and about ten hours on hobbies.  In a year each of these is
around 500 hours.  Vacationing is nice and is worth about 200 hours
(two weeks of time).  Let's double that with some shorter get-aways.

Summary of leisure time: 500 family, 500 hobbies, 400 vacation.


See also [[Time]]
fields.title: Annual Time Spent

 * every file lives in git

 * 1 file set = 1 git repo
 * sharing and deployment by pull
 * big files close at hand/small files everywhere
 * no backups
 * use text when possible
 * build bridges to other systems
 * use automation

 file server

* Emotional Needs *                 -*-muse-*-

*What I need from my lover*

These are the things that are my top emotional needs.  In order for me to feel happy and fulfilled I
must get these needs met regularly.

1. **Admiration**

I need Stacie to tell me that she thinks that I am smart, and that she views me as influential and successful.

2. **Desire for God**

I need to know that Stacie is passionate about God.  I find this very attactive about her.  I love
working together with her and sharing our spiritual journey.

3. **Meaningful conversation**

I love discussing dreams, values, and fears with Stacie.  I long to know how she feels about things
and love being able to share my inner most thoughts with her.

4. **Sexual fulfillment**

Our time in bed is absolutely wonderful.  Stacie is a fabulous lover and much more amorous than most
women.  I Love that about her.  I feel very fulfilled and satisfied with our sex life. I perfer to
make love between 4-7 days.

5. **Attractiveness**

I love that Stacie always pays attention to personal grooming and appearance without being obsessed
over it.  She has worked hard on controlling weight.  I am never ashamed to be seen with her and
love introducing her to people that I know.

See also MarriageImprovements, StacieNeeds

fields.text:
* Extreme Progress *                 -*-muse-*-

Unpredictable progress
    Progress does not happen at a predictable pace
    Sometimes things go very slowly and at other times very rapid progress is made
    What accounts for this difference

Applies to any creative endeavor
    Writing
    Business planning
    Project planning
    Engineering
    Programming

Key difference is "Flow"
    Flow happens when the brain is engaged at a subconscious level
    Right-brain thinking produces creative results
    Left-brain thinking produces critical thinking
    The critic kills creativity

Past investment kills flow
    Most creative tasks start with some existing solution already in place
    This produces a mental burden for accomodating what is
    The burden creates a critique for new solution ideas
    Remove this burden by acting like this is the first time to think about this topic

Find a great solution then accomodate what is
    Build a new solution as a "green field app"
    Work out the details fogetting what lies behind
    Then work out the bridging issues

Using a formal process
    What problem needs to be solved?
    From what I know now, how would I do it over?
    Is there value in the old that can be leveraged?
    Refactor the new design to take advantage of the old one?


See also
fields.title: Extreme Progress

fields.text:
* T T D *                 -*-muse-*-

Test-driven development, or TDD, is an AGILE methodology that flips the development
lifecycle by ensuring that tests are written first, before the code is implemented, and that
tests drive the development (and are not just used as a validation tool).

The tenets of TDD are simple:
 * Code is written only when there is a failing test that requires the code to pass
 * The bare minimum amount of code is written to ensure that the test passes
 * Duplication is removed at every step
 * Once all tests are passing, the next failing test is added for the next required functionality.

These simple rules ensure that:
 * Your code develops organically, and that every line of code written is purposeful.
 * Your code remains highly modular, cohesive, and reusable (as you need to be able to test it).
 * You provide a comprehensive array of tests to prevent future breakages and bugs.
 * The tests also act as specification, and thus documentation, for future needs and
changes.

We at AngularJS have found this to be true, and the entire AngularJS codebase has been
developed using TDD. For an uncompiled, dynamic language like JavaScript, we strong
ly believe that having a good set of unit tests will reduce headaches in the future!
fields.title: T T D

* Kingdom Of God *                 -*-muse-*-

The kingdom is about God's authority in my life.
    Within the kingdom there are different realms that represent local areas of control
    Each realm is in a different state of unrest or rebellion
    Periodically it is critical to get a briefing on the war
    Each land has a unique set of conditions and circumstances to confront

Questions for review
    What does piece look like? 
    What does unrest look like?
    Briefing on the past, present, and future of this realm?
    Gratitude --> Contentment, Simplicity, Generosity

Realm of Knowledge

    spiritual growth
        receiving God's love replaces religious striving
        gratitude overflows
        peace and acceptance of myself and others
        trusting daily in God's will
        regular time with God

    technical knowledge
        content with what I know
        stop comparing myself to others
        secure that I can learn what is needed
        clear path for future learning

    books & ideas
        content with what I have already read
        enjoy the available time to read and discover
        book list without expectations
        regular time to read & discover        

    travel & recreation
        enjoy activities more
        variety of leisure activities

        balance of personal and social

Realm of Relationship

        clear focus for areas to grow

        realistic expectations

    professional reputation

    business relationships
        looking to serve

        long-term partnerships

    family
        loving and close marriage

        maintain connection with extended family

Realm of Goals

    time
        review and planning cycles (day,week,month,quarter,year)
        allocation balanced with values
        balance of work vs. play
        flexible when needed
        clear goals in each area

    expectations
        realistic goals
        avoid predicting future outcomes
        shift to desired investment
        map of desires

    incremental planning
        recognize and celbrate accomplishments
        capitalize on past accomplishments
        focus on direction not destination
        progress is related to invested time

    prioritization
        I can do anything but not everything
        project pyramid
        stable goals over time
        monthly objectives

Realm of Creativity

    thought life
        time for thinking
        build maps and models

fields.text:
* D V D Ripping *                 -*-muse-*-

Life Hacker article
http://lifehacker.com/380702/five-best-dvd-ripping-tools?utm_source=lifehacker.com&utm_medium=recirculation&utm_campaign=recirculation

MakeMKV (Win/OS X/Linux) http://makemkv.com/

We've praised MakeMKV before for its ability to quickly and easily rip DVDs and Blu-ray discs to
 high quality MKV files with a single click. The app has been in beta for a long time (years, in
 fact), which is just as well, since the developers promise to start charging for Blu-ray ripping
 once the app leaves beta. The app's strong suits are that it's fast, super easy, and cross-platform
 (the Linux version is available in the forums.) Plus, the app preserves all of the source disc's
 information, including tracks, chapters, HD audio, menus, and so on. The app is completely free. 

Handbrake (Win/OS X/Linux) http://handbrake.fr/

Handbrake is our favorite video encoder for a reason: it's simple, easy to use, easy to install, and
offers a wealth of tweaking options to get the best possible file as a result. If you're daunted by
them, you don't even have to use themthe app will compensate for you and pick some settings it
thinks you'll like based on your destination device. So many of you like Handbrake that many of you
use it in conjunction with another appyou'll let another app do the rip and crack the DRM on your
discs, and then process the file through Handbrake for encoding. The app is fast, can make the most
of multi-core processors to speed up the process, and is completely open source. Best of all, it's
completely free.
fields.title: D V D Ripping

fields.text:
* Addressed To God *                 -*-muse-*-

This journal is written as a prayer to You. I'm hoping that this will not be an abstract rambling,
but a heartfelt prayer in written form. I want to know You more. I need to spend more time with
You. Prayer is a tool that You have given us to process life's issues before You. Talking with You
about things is a much better way to understand truth, than simply telling another person.

Take this journal as an opportunity to reveal Your truth through Your Spirit. As I write, show me
what Your viewpoint is. Speak to me to bring encouragement, conviction, and passion into my
heart. The net result, that I hope for, is a deeper trust in You.
fields.title: Addressed To God

* Page Count *                 -*-muse-*-

*How long should my book be?*

 **50 pages - 13,000 words**  - Microbook (21 articles of 600 words)
**100 pages - 25,000 words**  - Short book for non-fiction
**300 pages - 75,000 words**  - Typical book for fiction
**500 pages - 125,000 words** - Long book for non-fiction

**Write a book in 50 hours** 
 - 2 pages per hour 
 - 100 pages in 50 days 
 - working 1 hour/day

**250 words per page** is generally considered to be standard. 


See also [[Writing]], ManuscriptLength

fields.text:
* Proverbs *                 -*-muse-*-

*Instructions for Life* - How to live the good life. Greatest hits from the book of Proverbs.

**God's direction:**

    Trust in the Lord with all your heart; do not depend on your own understanding.

    Seek his will in all you do, and he will show you which path to take.

    We can make our own plans, but the Lord determines our steps.

    The Lord directs our steps, so why try to understand everything along the way?

    Commit your actions to the Lord, and your plans will succeed.

    Don't be impressed with your own wisdom.  Instead, fear the Lord and turn away from evil.

    Don't reject the Lord's discipline and don't be upset when he corrects you.

**Wisdom:**

    Guard your heart above all else, for it determines the course of your life.

    Don't lose sight of common sense and discernment.  Hang on to them.

    Get the truth and never sell it; also get wisdom, discipline, and good judgment.

    Develop good judgment; getting wisdom is the wisest thing you can do!

    The wise are mightier than the strong, and those with knowledge grow stronger and stronger. 

    Listen and be wise: Keep your heart on the right course.
      
    Commit yourself to instruction; listen carefully to words of knowledge.

    Dont waste your breath on fools, for they will despise the wisest advice.

    So dont go to war without wise guidance; victory depends on having many advisers.

**Wealth:**

    Honor the Lord with your wealth and with the best part of everything you produce.

    Do your planning and prepare your fields before building your house.

    Dont wear yourself out trying to get rich. Be wise enough to know when to quit.

    Dont eat with people who are stingy; dont desire their delicacies.

    Do not carouse with drunkards or feast with gluttons, for they are on their way to poverty.

**Helping others:**

    Do not withhold good from those who deserve it when it's in your power to help them.

    If you can help your neighbor now; don't say, "Come back tomorrow, and I will help you".

    Rescue those who are unjustly sentenced to die; save them as they stagger to their death. 

    Dont excuse yourself by saying, Look, we didn't know. For God understands all hearts, and he sees you.

    Dont rejoice when your enemies fall; dont be happy when they stumble.

    Dont fail to discipline your children. Physical discipline may well save them from death.

    Dont testify against your neighbors without cause; dont lie about them.

    Dont cheat your neighbor by moving the boundary markers; dont take the land of the defenseless.

**Turn from evil:**

    Don't plot harm against your neighbor, for those who live nearby trust you.

    Don't pick a fight without reason, when no one has done you harm.

    Look straight ahead and fix your eyes on what lies before you. Mark out a straight path for your feet. 

    Don't get sidetracked; keep your feet from following evil.

    If sinners entice you, turn your back on them.  Don't go along with them! Stay far away from their paths.

    Fools are destroyed by their own complacency.

    Dont fret because of evildoers.

    Don't envy violent people or copy their ways. Dont envy evil people or desire their company.

    Dont envy sinners, but always continue to fear the Lord.
 

See also [[Prayer]]
fields.title: Proverbs

fields.text:
* Sample Budget *                 -*-muse-*-

We work to pay for stuff.  In fact we trade our work-time for the
things that we purchase.  The following sample budget illustrates how
this works.

Taxes                   $25K
Giving                  $10K
Saving                  $10K
Housing/utilities       $20K
Food/Groceries          $10K
Entertainment           $10K
Vacation                $10K
Car                     $5K
Unexpected expenses     $25K

    Total net earnings  $100K (gross earnings $125K)

Figure out a net earnings amount and use this to convert your money
budget into work-time.  In our example we have net earnings of $50/hour.

Giving                  200 hours
Saving                  200 hours
Housing/utilities       400 hours
Food/Groceries          200 hours
Entertainment           200 hours
Vacation                200 hours
Car                     100 hours
Unexpected expenses     500 hours

    Total work hours   2000 hours
    Taxes (500 hours as a part of all other line items)


See also [[Budget]]
fields.title: Sample Budget
