fields.text:
* Parts Of Self *                 -*-muse-*-

**Public Self**
This  is the area that I allow other people to see.  This is the
public persona that I construct and present to others.

**Private Self**
My private thoughts and inner feelings are not shared with others,
because it is believed to be safer that way.  This is different with
each person.  There are people that I share most thing with, resulting
in a small private self.  Others I share very little with for lack of
trust.  This makes for a large private self.

Beware of those areas that you are unwilling to share with anyone.
You should be able to share almost anything with someone.  Also beware
of discrepencies between the private and public identities.  This is
opportunity for self-destruction.

**Revealed Self**
This areas is the home of my blind spots.  I cannot see these thing
even though everyone else can. It is important to be in close enough
relationships that others can help us to identify the blind
spots. Then we can allow God to help us integrate those things into
our lives. 

**Unknown Self**
Sometimes there are mysteries that we don't understand.  We do things
that we cannot explain.  We feel a certain way about something that
defies an explanation.  During prayer God can begin revealing these
things to us.  Then he brings healing and restoration.

See also [[Brain]]
fields.title: Parts Of Self

fields.text:
* Problem Solving Template *                 -*-muse-*-

**Problem**

Overview - What is the main problem?

    Anxiety and frustration over tasks

Context - When does it happen?  What are the symptoms?

    paralysis & resignation
    feel overwhelmed 
    fear of failure
    insignificance
    must do everything before I can do anything
    feel panicked
    resources are never enough
    grand dreams that can never be fulfilled
    discontentment

Causes - What is the root?

    false identity & self-worth is tied to doing & trying to gain approval
    refusal to accept reasonable limitations leads to ridiculous expectations
    harsh assessment of accomplishments


**Solution**

Plan - How can this problem be solved? What changes will be implemented?

    realize that performance orientation will never generate proper self-esteem
    celebrate accomplishments (monthly summary) & acknowledge limitations
    keep a project list for each role
    manage roles: w,p,a,s, admin, family, church, me, fun
    budget time

Review - How do actual results compare to the expected ones?



Learning - What lessons can be applied in the future?
fields.title: Problem Solving Template

This practice was recommended by John Tesh. Make a list of things that you are thankful for. God,

The spiritual life is a complicated thing. It is about what is going on inside of me. The cosmic

fields.text:
* Jordan Stories *                 -*-muse-*-

**News is Distorted**

This is the first trip to the middle-east for Stacie and me. We are shocked by how little we truly
understand of this region.  The history is very rich, which means that the various conflicts run
very deep.

After just a few days it became clear that the news that we get in the US is very distorted.  It is
always filtered through a strong political agenda. Here, we are able to get a much fuller story from
both local residents and Americans that have lived here for decades.

Beyond the politics, we are able to see what God is doing in this area of the world.  He is at work
in many different ways.  I plan on writing a series of articles to relate experiences that we have
had, tell the stories of others, and show you how you can become involved in the work of God's
kingdom.

Stacie and I are currently in Amman, Jordan.  We are meeting with so many wonderful people and want
to tell their stories.  We hope that these stories prompt you to pray and feel a part of God's work
here.


**Training Jordanian Pastors**

On Thursday and Friday a training event was held for Jordanian pastors.  These men are sharing the
gospel and doing great work around the capital city of Amman.  Jordan has about 6.5 million people
with about half of them living in the greater Amman area.  70% of all people are under age 23, 35%
under 14.

Rick O. spoke about how God is moving in the youth.  This is a vital message for the church in
Amman. Youth tend to be much more open to change than their parents.  People are actively looking
for answers to the difficulties of living life.

A strategy for Rescuing, Reaching, Rooting, Releasing, and Resourcing youth may provide a model for
how to establish the church for the next generation.  The demographics of Jordan make this message
an extremely important one.

It is an amazing experience to be a part of worship in another culture and language.  Even though we
cannot understand most of what is spoken we recognize the exuberant praise and worship of our
common savior. 


**Let's Buy That Mountain**

Sometimes our faith is too small and our vision of God's heart is too limited.  When we see others
trusting him, then it gives us courage to step out into deeper waters.  

Yesterday, I saw an example of faith in action.  We visited a church in Jordan that is really moving
forward. The church appears to be made up of mostly people under 30. They have a heart for reaching
out to their city and nation.

The pastor had a vision for creating a camp for youth and young adults.  He located a piece of
property in the vicinity of Mt. Nebo (the spot where Moses died before the Jews entered the promised
land).  It is also not far from the location where Jesus was baptized in the Jordan river.

There is a building and olive trees on the property.  The view is spectacular with mountains and
steep ravines immediately on the edge of the property.  We stood on the mountain and tried to
imagine the giant throngs of people and livestock making there way through this spot down to the
river.

It is exciting to visualize how God will be using this spot to change the lives of so many people.
This location reminds me of the importance of acting on what God is leading us to do.  It is easy to
hear from him and not act on what he says.  But the blessing only come when we step into the
fullness of his plan.


**Responding to the Call to Prayer**

All over the Islamic world there is a call to prayer five times daily.  This is done through loud
speakers in many locations throughout the cities.  To westerners this is a strange practice.

Many people living here comment on how oppressive this feels.  But others use it as a legitimate
reminder to call out to God for his freedom.  People that see the call to prayer as an invitation,
end up praying more in the middle-east than at home.

It is important to have reminders in our lives to act as triggers to pursue God.  What reminders
could you use everyday to help you to connect with God on a regular basis?


**Jordan has a Key Role in God's Plan**

Jordan is an interesting place.  It has very few natural resources, is mostly desert, and has a very
young population.  The country is led by a king, who is very loved by the people.  Jordan is the
most stable government in the Arab world.

The country is mostly populated by people who have migrated from what is now Israel.  Each wave of
political upheaval in Israel results in more immigration to Jordan. This last year, unrest in Syria has
also resulted in 200,000 refugees in camps.  Conditions in these camps are extremely difficult.

Jordan is viewed by many as a place of refuge.  Jordan has also played a key role of peace in the
middle-east. In exchange for aid from the US, Jordan plays a peace-maker role between the other
countries with more extreme views.

This is a tricky balance.  Pray for continued peace in Jordan so that this area of the world would
be open to the gospel.  Ultimately, true and lasting peace can only come from the Lord.  We are
praying for God's transforming power on both individuals and nations.


**Leaders Coming to Christ**

I recently heard a story that I wanted to pass on.  Because of security concerns do not post this
information anywhere.  The names have been changed to protect the innocent.

One day, a brother in Christ got a phone call from an important Islamic leader.  Ibrahim was a
little worried, when Ahmed asked to meet with him.

When they met Ahmed told Ibrahim that he had been reading the bible and had a lot of questions.
They discussed the bible for many hours, and Ahmed opened his heart to the love of Christ.  Ahmed
was dramatically impacted by Jesus and wanted to be baptized.  

For an important leader to come to Christ is a huge commitment. This can be a very dangerous
situation for all involved. Please be praying for our new brother Ahmed.  Pray for his spiritual
growth and influence within the community.  Pray for wisdom to know what to do next.

God is on the move!


**Fuel Prices Spark Riots**

Fuel prices in Jordan skyrocketed last week.  Cooking fuel increased by 35% as government subsidies
were dropped.  For about three days there were regular demonstrations all over the country.  Some of
the protests turned voilent, but most were calm.

Almost a week later there were still riot police gathering around the mosques where the
demostrations are held.  Last night we saw armoured vehicles with mounted machine guns to keep the
demonstrations from getting out of hand.

Amy Hybels is a journalist that attends Oasis.  She posted this report.

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=4Bi8wDuErRU


**Partnership is the Key**

Historically, churches has squabbled and competed with one another.  This is utterly contrary to
God's will.  Jesus prayed that we would be one in the same way that he was united with the Father.
This is still his desire for us.

As people have worked in other countries it is common to come in with a superior attitude.  The
countries that have a rich heritage of faith assume that they have all of the answers.  This is not
the attitude of Christ.

The gospel in rooted in many places throughout the world.  It is vital that we recognize the work of
God in every place we go.  In Jordan, there is a thriving church among the Arab people.  We must
come alongside the church and bless them.

We must come as learners.  Our role, although important, is secondary to the role of the Jordanian
church.  Our primary goal is to bless what God is already doing, and serve the church that is
already in place.

The spirit of partnership, is recognizing that God has given each of us a role within his kingdom.
Each part of the body can do it's thing and then the entire body is built up and strengthened.  We
are better together than anyone is alone.

It is a joy to serve alongside our brothers and sisters around the world.


**Difficulty with Daily Life**

I have been struck by how different daily life is here in Jordan.  Things that I simply take for
granted are a big deal. 

Transportation is the first thing that I noticed.  A trip across town is very simple in the US.  It
could easily take an hour to get somewhere.  Cars cost about twice what they would in the US and
traffic is wild.  Amman is very spread out.

Sometimes, when road construction is done the road is simply blocked off and people drive through
empty lots to create a new route to where they are going. Since we have been here, there have been
many protests, which also block roads.

People also put a lot of effort into getting kids to school, doing laundry and getting food, fuel,
and water.  These things take only minor thought at home, but here, they take a major part of the
day.

Life here seams to run about an hour later than what is scheduled and last about an hour
longer. There is a certain level of appeal to this more relaxed pace, but it requires a conscious
adjustment for us westerners.

Strong schedules with many events planned can be a source of frustration for many Americans
here. Hospitality takes precedence over timeliness.  Maybe we can learn something from them.


**The Hope of the Gospel**

I look to the mountains.  Where does my help come from?  This world is seriously broken.  Being in a
different culture reveals new ways that we are broken.

All of humanity operates under the curse of sin.  Ethnic hatred, prejudice, murder, abuse, slavery,
corruption, and poverty are simply symptoms of this curse.  As we are willing to see, we can feel
overwhelmed. 

Where do we start to fix our world?  How can we make a difference?  Is our hope is better
government? Do we really believe that if our party wins then the world will become a magical place
of sparkling lights?

Our only hope for the world, is that God would transform peoples hearts. We must start with our own
hearts. As my heart is transformed by the presence of God, he gives me eyes to see what he is
doing. 

Fixing the world is a God-sized problem, not a man-sized one.  On our own we can do nothing. But God
can transform a community, nation, and world.  He invites us to be used in specific ways.  But
ultimately, he is the one that does the work.

Jesus invites us as his bride to work in partnership. He directs, but we respond.  He empowers, but
we obey.  Together we make the world a better place, not though human effort alone. But in
partnership with the Spirit of God, we will move back the darkness.


<------------  posted 


**Bible Training Camp**

One of the pastors in Jordan came up with a idea to train people in the bible.  It is often
difficult and often dangerous for people to study the bible when in their home town.  Family members
and others in the community usually opposed to the the bible.  This can often result in violent
retaliation for both the student and the teacher.

This pastor found that by getting people out of the country that they were much more open to the
Lord.  He has created a bible study retreat in a different country.  It is like an emersion class in
bible study and prayer.

This has been a very effective strategy and has changed the lives of many people.  It is wonderful
to see how different people are responding to God's call and willing to take large risks for the gospel.


**Headlines**

Building Bridges, Not Walls

One Person Can Make a Difference

Courage to Act

**Heart for All People**

Self-interest is Not Enough

**Source of All Conflict**

**Prince of Peace**

**Blood Brothers**


See also JordanTrip
fields.title: Jordan Stories

fields.text:
* Wm Git Repos *                 -*-muse-*-
Jan 2, 2013 -- Reset the server repos for Watermill

**Motivation**
Match the use of git repos to the actual problem.  Data and code have two different lifecycles.

**Resetting Git Repos**
Save old repo
    commit all changes
    mkdir ~/Git
    mv ~/.git ~/Git/2012-support.git

Create new bare repos
    cd ~/Git
    git init --bare 2013-support.git
    git init --bare 2013-data.git
    echo data >> ~/.gitignore

Working directory
    git status
    git pull
    git push
    echo "test file" > test-file
    git add test-file
    git commit -m'Test file'
    git pull
    git push
 
Local clone
    mkdir ~/Git && sur && mv .git ~/Git/2012-support.git
    sur && git clone $wm:Git/2013-support.git && mv 2013-support.git .
    sud && git clone $wm:Git/2013-data.git    && mv 2013-data.git .


See also GitRepo
fields.title: Wm Git Repos

fields.text:
* Mill Probe *                 -*-muse-*-

What is Mill Probe?

There is a program called 'millcmd' that runs on each watermill.  It is used to get and set live
data values on a running mill.

Mill Probe is a tool that can be used from a remote computer to interrogate a watermill.  This
creates a remote access for the 'millcmd' data in a watermill.

Mill Probes only support getting the data values for security reasons.


How does it work?

The mill probe system is made up of several different components that work together.  Each part of
the system is very simple, but together the system is quite sophisticated.  The components are:

 * Mill Probe Server
 * Mill Probe Script
 * Probe Command
 * Mill Command
 * Node.JS
 * Probe HTML


Mill Probe Server

This application runs on each watermill.  It provides a web service interface to answer queries.  It
uses a URL to request that a particular Mill Probe Script be run on the watermill.  

Example:
    http://65.121.123.216:3002/pressure
    This url requests that the pressure script be run on the watermill located at 65.121.123.216.
    The results are gathered and returned as a web response.


Mill Probe Script

On each watermill there are scripts that contain a list of millcmd variables.  Each script is a mill
probe.  Each script can be invoked by executing it on the remote watermill.

Example:
    sc-milldo 3006 'millcmd probe/pressure'


Probe Command

On the watermill support servers (production, staging, development) a probe command can be
executed. This command when find the appropriate probe to be executed on the requested unit.  This
is based on the software version running on the requested unit.

The probe command is executed remotely by sending the correct web request to the Mill Probe Server
on the watermill.  The results are then returned as a text file to the caller.

Example:
    sc-probe 3006 pressure


Mill Command

This command lives on the watermill.  It does the actual variable lookup on the live mill.  Results
are returned as text.

Example:
    millcmd presssure.mc


Node.JS

The Mill Probe Server is a lightweight web server that is built using a server-side JavaScript
library, called Node.JS.  This is an extremely efficient way to create a web server that does
something simple.  Each watermill must have Node.JS installed.

Example:
    apt-get install nodejs


Probe Definition

Each probe is defined by a list of variables for millcmd and labels to show them in english.  When
executed on a watermill each value is read from the Mill Probe Server.  Then the value is formatted
by the matching string to display it in a friendly way.

Example:
    label_map = {
        'production.tankLevel.state.fillNeeded' : 'Tank level state fill needed %s',
        'production.tankLevel.state.floatSwitchState' : 'Tank level float switch %s',
    }


Probe HTML

Each probe returns a block of text when executed.  This results in a nicely formatted list of data
values that are obtained from a running mill.  This text is then wrapped in the '< pre >' tag to
preserve the spacing.

Example:
    < pre >
        Tank level state fill needed 42
        Tank level float switch 1
    < /pre >


Building a new probe

Probes are created on the server.  A new probe requires a name, a unit number, and a variable string
pattern to use in millcmd.  The existing file will not be overwritten to eliminate accidents.  The
probe will be created for the software version matching the unit.

Once a Probe Definition is create it can be manually edited to present the data value in a friendly
way. 

Example:
    sc probe-make 3006 pressure state.pressure
    This creates a Probe Definition (probes/pressure-5.9.probe)
    

Managing software versions

Probes are all tied to minor versions of software.  For example, 7.0.4 and 7.0.6 are both minor
version 7.0.

When working with a probe the system will automatically match the probe version to the unit
version.  A lookup table is Support Center allow you to avoid doing this mapping manually.

Example:
    sc probe-exec 3006 pressure
    Execute the probe 'probes/pressure-5.9.probe' on unit 3006
fields.title: Mill Probe

fields.text:
* Prayer Affections *                 -*-muse-*-

*Core attitudes of the heart*
________________________________________________________________________________________

A recent sermon taught about how to cure Affluenza, which is the stress, and emptiness that comes
from the endless quest for more. 

There are three key ways to shift our focus from materialism to things that really matter.

1. **Contentment**
 * How am I dissatisfied?
 * How much is enough?
 * Focus on grattitude

2. **Simplicity**
 * Where can I prune?
 * Alter expectations
 * Build margin

3. **Generosity**
 * Where can I serve others?
 * Managers not owners
 * Freedom to love others
________________________________________________________________________________________

This can be applied in every area of life:

    **Area**          **Lesson to learn**

    Money       - budget will help to show unintended spending
    Time        - flexible planning and prioritization
    Learning    - reduce expectations
    Affection   - be more generous with affection
    Praise      - look for opportunities to praise others
    Empowerment - call others to action
    Success     - set expectations based on personal limitations
    Recognition - be content with recognition
    Marriage    - focus on meeting Stacie's need
    Church      - create flexibility to hear from God
    Career      - be content with current realities
    Family      - enjoy each person as much as possible
    Relationships- invest in people that God has connected me with

Scriptures to ponder - I Jn 2, I Tim 6


See also PrayerPractices
fields.title: Prayer Affections

* Install Cygwin *                 -*-muse-*-

This lesson assumes that you are learning how to use Linux but still stay within the Windows
environment.  If you are using Linux then you are done for today.  Take a vacation and come back
tomorrow.

Download the installer from the http://www.cygwin.com/install.html web site.  Get it configured to its default location.

Now run cygwin and login. Do 'cd', 'ls', 'man ls'.  If these work you are done for today.

If you are not familiar with vi then read this section:

   vi filename -- Edit the file named filename
   ZZ  -- Save and exit
   i -- Insert mode takes characters that you type into the buffer
   ESC -- Exit escape mode
   j,k,l,m -- Move cursor when not in insert mode

Try these basics until you feel comfortable.

See also DaysOfLinux
fields.title: Install Cygwin

fields.text:
* Pricing Web Development *                 -*-muse-*-
*Pricing new projects at Shrinking World Solutions*

**Hourly Pricing**

The primary reason to choose hourly pricing is to share risk and create a flexible scope for the
project. This reduces the overall risk to the client by allowing the project to meet the minimum
functionality and then stop. Most project have a large amount of unknown factors that make it very
difficult to set scope at the beginning.

A project can produce a steady stream of results to the client.  This will allow you to set the
agenda for what gets developed next, and make any necessary changes.  You can guide the project
throughout rather than commit to all of the features upfront.

Shrinking World Solutions recommends this form of pricing for most projects.  It is the most
flexible way to produce the quickest and cheapest result.  Hourly rates are established by the skill
level of the person doing the task (typically between $50 - $135).


**Fixed Pricing**

This model can work well for projects that are fully understood at the outset.  This is often the
case when replacing an existing system with new technology.  Under this model each piece of
functionality is built into the price.  A price list is used to set the price of the overall
project.

Following is a sample price list.  This is used for illustration only since the details for each
project vary greatly.

 * Gathering requirements & design work  (these both scale with the project and are priced into the
   other parts of the model)
 * Testing is built in to the development time
 * Final acceptance testing is done by the client
 * Setup web hosting and deployment (typical web hosting is inexpensive)

 * Data types (eg. customers, order, part numbers)          $1000/type
 * Web views (eg. add customer, list orders)                $500/view
 * Data import/export formats (eg. send/receive orders)     $1000/file type
 * Security (eg. customer logins, SSL, SSH)                 $1000/feature
fields.title: Pricing Web Development

fields.text:
* Celebrate Accomplishments *                 -*-muse-*-

Each person has several talent themes that can be both a strength and a weakness.  These are
discribed in detail in "Strength's Finder 2.0".  One of the talent themes is called Achiever.  This
compells a person to accomplish great things with a high energy level.

But it can also give people a value of self-worth that is determined by what they have accomplished
in the last day.  One of the significant weaknesses of the Achiever talent is that it is difficult
to sense satisfaction in acheivements.  The thrill disipates very quickly.

This makes it essential for people with Achiever to find ways to extend the enjoyment for past
accomplishments. One practice that I have found helpful is to celebrate the successes. If there is
not a conscious pratice of celebration, then the Achiever will naturally be drawn into a despondency
over what was not done.

I find it all but impossible to enjoy the accomplishments of the past while still dealing with the
challenges of the future.  New goals quickly eclipse old ones.  Past deeds are immediately replaced
by new unmet demands.  Celebration can break this downward spiral.

This form of celebration has several distinct parts:

**recall** - make a list of everything that was done, or was was learned along the way

**organize** - group things together into themes and extract the key learning

**dream** - about where you would like to take this accomplishment in the future

**share** - your ideas with others that can appreciate what you did

**prioritize** - assess how important this accomplishment is relative to other possible investments

Consider doing this type of activity, monthly, quarterly, and yearly.  This will energize other
activities you do.  You might set aside a whole day once a quarter to review your past achievements
and plan new ones.  Celebration should play a central role in this type of planning.

See also PersonalRetreat
fields.title: Celebrate Accomplishments

fields.text:
* Trust Ramp *                 -*-muse-*-
The trust ramp is a model for how relationships form over time.

**Applies to every type of relationship**
Marriage, Kids, Clients, Colleagues, Friends
Built into our psyche
Defines the operation of relationships

**Starts at zero**
No initial data on which to assume trust
Must start small
Fulfilled expectations built more trust
Disappointments can reset it
Internal tug-of-war

**The next step is proportional to the level gained**
With low trust, low risk is warranted
High trust allows for high risk
Relationships can be managed to build more trust
There is an optimal rate to progress

**Trust can be measured**
What is the most risk that someone would be willing to take?
Match opportunities with history
Design the ramp
Always have the next step planned

See also [[Business]]
fields.title: Trust Ramp

* Bash Tricks *                 -*-muse-*-

**Using new style test in Bash**

# Old style test
if [ -d 'directory' ]
then
    echo Directory Exists
else
    echo No directory
fi


# New style test
# Execute if test is true
[ [ -d 'directory' ] ] && echo Directory Exists && exit 0
echo No directory

# Execute unless test is true
[ [ -d  'directory' ] ] || echo No Directory && exit 0
echo Directory exits

See also [[Brain]]

fields.text:
* To Do Rules *                 -*-muse-*-

Simple rules for managing tasks, projects, and planning.

Actions
 * If it's quick do it now
 * Add actions longer than 2 minutes to the list 
 * Capture ideas quickly
 * Group related actions
 * Prioritize groups
 * Review list hourly
 * Limit random distractions by adding to the list
 * Dispatch all items for each input queue
 * Limit the urgent list to ten

Projects
 * If it takes more than an hour, it's a project
 * Prune off as many projects as you add
 * Limit the active projects to twenty
 * Prioritize active projects
 * Review the someday list weekly

Goals
 * Think through the impact of adding new goals
 * Capture new goals first as ideas
 * Reduce the scope of the planned goals
 * Large projects reflect an ongoing role
     Calendar, Home, Administration, Church, Watermill, Semantic Arts, My Book, Writing
 * Create a context for each role

See also [[Brain]], [[Projects]]
fields.title: To Do Rules

fields.text:
* Spiritual Journal *                 -*-muse-*-

*Ideas about spiritual things*
___________________________________________________________________________________________________

**Journal Purpose**

This journal is intended to encourage my spiritual development by increasing the amount of time I
spend thinking about issues of spiritual growth. What gets fed grows, so it is time to feed the
spirit. I don't feel that much time has been given to the things of the spirit over the last couple
of years. It is time for a change.

This journal follows a few simple rules, AbsoluteHonesty is required to produce anything of
value. The journal is AddressedToGod and could be used as a prayer. I intend to update this journal
as part of a program for improving my OngoingHabits.

I am desiring to pursue You more diligently and consistently on a daily basis. Keeping a spiritual
journal is a key part of my life with You. It causes me to have an increased awareness and focus on
what You are doing within me and the issues that are driving my thoughts.

I have shared this commitment to journaling with Stacie, Dick Spitler, and Bruce Hoppe. This will
provide some accountability for me for additional motivation.

My plan is to write something every day in this journal. It doesn't have to be a lot, but it must be
something. For the next 40 days I will record my progress each day and restart if I miss a day. At
then end of that time I will celebrate my new habit of journaling.


**Daily Needs**

Each day depends on Your provision and blessing. It is so hard to comprehend or remember that
truth. In my daily striving it is so easy to think that everything depends on me. I ask You to give
me the things that I need for today. Give me wisdom to know how this day should be spent.

Being a two-cracker guy I want to store up manna for the future, instead of trusting You to provide
for tomorrow as well as You do today. Help me to focus my attentions on the things that are needed
today rather than borrow trouble from tomorrow.

It is so wonderful to see how GodProvides. ThankYou for all of Your blessings. But I want our
relationship to move BeyondBlessings.  


**In The Present**

Help me to meet with You in the present. That is the best place where I can experience Your
presence. I can recieve Your mercy, Your peace, Your guidance, Your correction, and Your power
working in me.

Each moment I can reach out and touch You. I can call out to You. I can surrender my will to You,
but only in the present. Recalling a time when we were close is meaningless if my heart is rebelling
now. Anticipating a time when I will lay it all down is false if right now I refuse to yield.

My will operates in the now. I choose to yield or wrest control only now. The past and the future
don't really matter when it comes to meeting with You. Help me to see my life as a series of
individual moments that might be spent with You, rather than wasted on self indulgence.

Now is the time when I can depend on You for my DailyNeeds. Now is the time when I can ThankYou for
what You have done.


**By Your Grace**

I am amazed how hard it is for me to remain aware that it is all about You. I so easily revert to
believing that somehow I am responsible for carrying this relationship forward. Yet when I look deep
in my heart it is clear that there is nothing good that You did not put there.

Thank You for wooing me to You. Thank You for choosing me to follow You. Thank You for transforming
my heart. Thank You for the further transformation that is yet to take place. Thank You for the
ultimate destination of eternity with You.

Without Your power working in my life there is still no hope for me. It is not as if You have fixed
me and now I can take it from here. I am more accurately in a constant state of spiritual brokenness
and You are all that stands between me and the abyss.


**Daily Habits**

Rick Warren described nine habits to make us more loving

Physical Habits
    Rest
    Exercise
    Diet

Emotional Habits
    Recreation
    Laughter
    Helping others

Spiritual Habits
    Solitude
    Service
    Denying yourself


**Quiet Time Activities**

There are a number of essential activities that replensih the spirit. These enhance life and must be done regularly.

    Worship
    Thanksgiving
    Acknowledge my fears
    Forgive others
    Reflect on what is going well
    Explore changes
    Read scripture
    Prayer journal
    Read inspirational book
    Read training book
    Read blogs
    Imagine three years from now
    Plan a good deed
    Weekly review and planning
    Analyze a big problem
    Review the last 90 days
    Reflect on recent learning
    Make a list of books to read
    Identify great sources of joy
    Write my life story
    Examine last year
    Write in journal


**My Dream Job** - These are based on my Work Values

Following are my characteristics for a dream job.

    I use my strengths every day
    My clients appreciate my expertise
    I earn a high wage per hour worked
    90% of the total work time is billable
    There is a feeling of teamwork and respect
    I am making an important contribution each day
    I am paid to learn new things
    The work location is flexible allowing me to work part of the time at home
    I can get work when I need it
    Clients trust my judgment
    I have flexibility to take time off
    Selling is not the main focus of the job
    I am able to establish ongoing relationships with clients
    I trust my clients
    I can see a way to be successful
    Creativity is required to solve new problems
    I learn and share best practices
    I organize tasks within a project
    The client desires agility
    Minimal time is spent on people issues
    Efficiency and effectiveness are important
    My expertise is unique


**Pray For Work**

Your word tells us DontWorry and yet I often worry when I should pray instead. You know the
importance of work in my life. Even though I am currently employed there is a degree of uncertainty
associated with it.

Today I found myself concerned that I would not be able to keep steady work coming. One prospect
that was a significant hope appears less so now. An existing client is struggling to pay me for
previous work. It is easy to fixate on the circumstance rather than the provider.

Lord, You have always given us so much more than we have ever needed. Thank You for Your constant
care for us. I know that You will be there for us no matter what situations we face. Thanks for Your
peace.


**Ideal Work**

Optimize the following attributes

    Low stress - 1 problem sleeping / month
    Invested time - 50 hours / week
    Total income - $/hour invested
    Value produced - Billable rate $70


**Embracing Brokenness**

I try so hard to be self sufficient and in complete control. But true dependence on You requires
that I get to the end of my resources. As long as I can create the life that I want without You then
I am not really trusting You.

When I finally have arrived at the end of my own abilities then You are there to meet me. You are
more interested in relationship than my comfort. Brokenness is the place where I completely
surrender to You.

Brokenness is where I discover Your plan and purpose for me. Because I have given up on my dreams
You are able to give me new ones. Not only is the goal different, but the means are also changed. I
trade self-sufficiency for Your power.

Brokenness is the state where I realize that You are God and I am not. It is when I become teachable
and moldable. Until I have been broken I can not serve Your purpose.

Brokenness replaces self-delusion with truth. It makes me acknowledge what has always been true -
that You are in control.

At the Iron Men's breakfast my answer came. Jerry White spoke about facing loss. He said that every
man will face 5 types of loss. Men will lose identity, influence, position, motivation, and
security.

He described my situation. We all experience this loss ,but we are always surprised by it.

I recognized that You had put me in this situation for His purpose. It was no accident. You were
doing something inside of me that would make the discomfort worth it.

That changed my perception of the whole situation. It was no longer about the reasons for the
issues. I needed to understand what You were desiring to do within me.

I try everything in our power to fix the situation. Sometimes it is the very situation that You are
using to fix me.

Brokenness is an emotional state where we embrace truth.
Self sufficiency keeps us from discovering the truth.
In brokenness we find truth.

In our need we find a provider.
In our illness we find a healer.
In our despair we find a savior.

We want the provider, healer, and savior. We just don't want to be in a state where we need it.


**Fear Itself**

If left to our own nature we will be consumed by fear. There are many bad things that could happen
to us. It is tempting to engage in fantasies about how bleak the future could be.

Hope is creating a positive fantasy of the future. Some people are by nature more hopeful. The real
basis of all our hope is You, God. If You control the shape of our lives and direct its course then
we can trust You completely with the future.

Help me to have this sense of security and peace about the future. I am tired of living in
fear. Show me how I can live a life of complete faith in You.


**So Much Pain**

This world is filled with pain. There are so many things that are out of control due to the fallen
nature of this world. Every person faces a series of struggles to make something good out of our
lives. It often seems that the human drama is this struggle itself. How do we survive and even
thrive in world broken by sin?

Teach me how to depend on You for everything. Show me how to serve others and give them hope.


**Beyond Blessings**

It is true that You give us everything that we need. But I don't want that to be the
sole basis of our relationship together. I know that You don't want that either. Forgive me for
seeking Your blessings and not Your intimacy.

I want to be Your friend and Your son, not just legally, but in practical reality. I want my daily
reality, and choices to be determined by You. I desire to live my life in Your presence as an act of
worship.

**Connecting With People**

When I think about communicating with people, I am consumed with my role in the relationship. This
takes two forms: what can I get from them, and what should I communicate. This is all wrong and
twisted. It means that every relationship is about me.

Lord, help me to see as valuable and interesting in their own right, rather than means to achieve my
self-centered goals. Give me an attitude of service toward others. Show me ways that I can serve
without expecting repayment of any kind.

I am so ashamed of my selfishness. Help me to change. Give me Your attitude for people.


**My Fears**

These are my greatest fears:

    rejection
    exposure
    ridicule
    insignificance
    lack of resources
    injury
    sickness
    pain
    death
    loss of sexuality
    loss of faith
    loss of identity
    loss of security
    loss of control
    being alone
    loss of a loved one
    hopelessness
    loss of position
    loss of influence
    lost motivation

Fear is such a powerful influence in life. Lord help me to allow You into my fears. Give me the
strength to surrender even the darkest fears to You.


**My Plan Vs Gods**

I love to create plans. This is my way of establishing control. These plans are often in conflict
with Your plan and purpose for me.

You see the beginning from the end. While my view is incredibly limited, Your's is not. You really
do know what is best.

Over the past year I have learned more about how dependent I am on You. Without You I can't do
anything. Help me, Lord, to embrace Your presence daily.

The Lord directs our steps, so why try to understand everything along the way?


See also  AddressedToGod,  AbsoluteHonesty, OngoingHabits, LifeCycle
fields.title: Spiritual Journal

fields.text:
* Auto Focus *                 -*-muse-*-
Simple technique for time management

**Goals:**
    Every task is either completed or discarded
    One list to rule them all
    Minimize overhead of working the system

**Process:**
    Four lists: New, Recurring, Unfinished, Old
    create starting list of "old" tasks
    new items are added to new list
    select from the old and work it
    completed items are removed
    imcomplete items are moved to unfinished
    work lists in order
    when old list is done new items become old


**work order:** new, recur, old, unfinished

**lists:** old, unfinished (or recurring*), new

[[http://lifehacker.com/5704856/the-autofocus-productivity-method-stop-maintaining-to+do-lists-and-start-getting-stuff-done][Auto Focus article]] & books


See also PersonalManagement

fields.text:
* Wm Release Process *                 -*-muse-*-

*Release 3002 Series Mills ASAP*

**Release Criteria**
Find all remaining defects (20 defects/1000 hours of testing)
Fix or defer all known defects (0 critical or serious or moderate remaining)
No outstanding design mysteries
Support tools/process

**Testing**

Record testing progress
 * List of all test cases (system, subsystem)
 * Use as checklist, record last date tested and pass/fail
 * Levels of testing: regular usage, technician, engineer

Types of testing
 * customer: regular usage in a real world way with abuse
 * technician: test each subsystem using the checklist
 * engineer: invasive methods to test defect fixes
 * unit tests: track test coverage, extend if possible

**Outstanding defects**

Update a burndown graph daily
Use estimate of 2 defects/engineer day to project release date
Focus all engineering effort on fixing defects
When outstanding defect < 20, daily review of details
All defects have an owner, balance the work load

**Design mysteries**

Outstanding defects can indicate weak design areas
Design mysteries trump defects
Daily tracking of key design areas
Only type of restructuring allowed until after release


See also WmDefects
fields.title: Wm Release Process

fields.text:
* Development Rules *                 -*-muse-*-

**Verify the baseline**
Make that the baseline can be automatically tested
Use the base to compare against variable results
Move the baseline when new tests are in place
When in trouble revert to the baseline

**Limit the scope of work**
Build in small steps
Use a smaller step that answers key questions
Build feedback systems
Shorten the time to learn

**Build on a stable base**
Defects breed
Prevent rework
Design the right answer and implement the expedient one
If you lose control, get it back

**Testing is the central focus**
Test it, investigate any surprises, & fix problems
For each failure reduce the scope; each success enlarges it
Make testing easy
Testing eliminates debug

**Make everything visible**
Have a one day, week, and month plan
Post all info in a public place
Use burndown stats to drive project
Reconcile business needs with engineering capability


See also [[Watermill]], [[WorldClassSoftware]], RapidDevelopment, WmStartDevelopment

Story: illustration of of how a trait was used

* Simple Tricks *                 -*-muse-*-

**Areas**
select technologies that require a trick catalog
select primary topical areas for each technology

**Tricks**
identify specific tricks within each area
highlight the key point to mastering this trick
define rules for each trick
create a detailed description of how the use the trick
create an example to illustrate


_____________________________________________________________________________

**Trick #1** - Define rules for tricks

1. Anyone can reproduce the trick with available materials.

2. Title (limit of 5 words) is the result.

3. Entire recipe can be written on a 3x5 card.

4. 5 minutes to try it out.

5. Numbered tricks are shared with others.
_____________________________________________________________________________

**Trick #2** - Capture an idea in a file.

1. Create a shell script (or power shell script)
    Script: idea
    echo $*>>~/ideas
    cat ~/ideas

2. Run the script from a console prompt
    Example:   idea Create idea list


See also FiftyTricks
fields.title: Simple Tricks

fields.text:
* Burst Worksheet *                 -*-muse-*-

Spend 5 minutes on each

    **Learn**      define the problem
    **Plan**       plan the steps
    **Test**       look for common failures
    **Fix**        solve problems as they appear
    **Extend**     build a solution
    **Improve**    review future opportunity

_____________________________________________________________________________

**Create report view on production server**
create test for doc/, doc/test, doc/report pages
test locally using web-pages.tst


**Follow up**

    shorten long running tests
    pay taxes
    order scanner
    order file folders
    create timer app
    trun scripts
    uninstall constant innovation blog
    use pycharm
    fix tests on staging server
    refine capture process
_____________________________________________________________________________

**Burst Mode Process**

**Learn**   define a burst mode process
**Plan**    create a template for other user stories
**Test**    try the burst mode on itself
**Fix**     simple approach seems to work the best
**Extend**  build a reusable template
**Improve** apply to user stories and business stories, build future stories

_____________________________________________________________________________

**Business Story Process**

**Learn**   define an agile method for setting business direction
**Plan**    create a template for business development using a story
**Test**    completed stories provide direct evidence
**Fix**     need to create method for capturing future stories and planning
**Extend**  create a section on the biz portal for stories
**Improve** review and refine the process after each story is completed

_____________________________________________________________________________

**Admin Burst**

**Learn**   house payment, credit cards
**Plan**    pay 3 months of housing
            pay April cap one
            pay business card
**Test**    cap one statement
            well fargo balances
            first tech statement
_____________________________________________________________________________

**Pay taxes**

**Learn**   make three tax payments
**Plan**    transfer money from buffer
        write checks
        scan checks
**Test**    ensure money in account
        checks are correctly written
        scans done
        docs saved
        envelopes mailed
**Fix**     convert password on tax file
**Extend**  balances, checks, records, mail
**Improve** minimize the steps



See also UserStoryProcess, BurstMode

*Easiest way to deploy applications*

**Benefits of Cloud Computing**
 * Someone else maintains the hardware and software
 * 100% uptime (when internet is available)
 * Clients can not destroy applications
 * Very low cost  (typically $20/month)
 * Large number of choices

**Risks of Cloud Computing**
 * Someone else manages the files
 * Apps can be hard to set up
 * Inproper configuration may create vulnerabilities
 * Apps are only available when internet is up

**Turn Key Appliances**
 * Fully installed and working application in a Virtual Machine
 * Installer to deploy VM appliance into cloud
 * Typical application (less than $20/month)
 * Amazon Web services (S3, EC2)

See also VirtualBox, MindTouch, TurnKey

fields.text:
* Brain Pruning *                 -*-muse-*-

Your brain is constantly taking on new information.  The context for previously added information is
also evolving.  The process of pruning is necessary to keep the information in your brain current.
Without pruning your brain will become a tattered mess of irrelevant topics and incorrect
connections. 

A good place to start pruning is with the oldest topics.  The older the topic the longer it has had
to become irrelevant.  List the twenty oldest topics and select one that you think might be out of
date.  Edit that topic and review the content.  Is it even useful anymore?  If so bring it up to
date.   Now update the connections that it has to the rest of your topics.  How does it fit within
the given context?


See also [[Brain]]

fields.text:
* Letter From Jesus *                 -*-muse-*-

The following letter was written to the church of Philippians.  But it is also a personal letter
delivered by the Holy Spirit to me in December 2011.  The words are different but the message is
true to the original.
___________________________________________________________________________________________________

Dear Mark,

When I think of you I feel real joy.  I started the work in you and will finish it.  My presence and
provision is with you, even in suffering and pain.

I want for your life to overflow with love.  I desire for you to keep growing in knowledge and
understanding.  You need to understand what really matters in order to live in purity, waiting for
me.

I saved you initially and will produce my character in you.  This process glorifies me and is what I
intended from the start.

You can be confident that both your life and death will bring me honor. You live for me, but dying
is an even better deal for you.

Your life is about helping others grow to understand the joy of trusting me.  My presence in your
life will give you even more confidence in me.

Living like true citizens of my kingdom honors me.  Keep on living for what really matters, even
when others are not there to encourage you.  I will restore everything, so don't be intimidated by
anything. 

I have started a profound work in you.  I gave you hope and a sense of belonging.  My love brings
you peace and comfort and my Spirit brings you unity with other believers.  I have planted love and
compassion deep within you.

Continue this unity by wholeheartedly agreeing with others, fully loving them, and working well
together.  Don't be selfish or try to impress others.  Both of these are rooted in pride.  Be
humble, thinking of others as more important. Put the interests of others before your own.

Have my attitude about others. I was willing to deny my own deity.  Instead I gave up my divine
glory and became a human slave.  I was executed as a lowly and despised criminal.

As a result I now have the highest reputation possible.  I am the rightful object of worship for
everything living on earth and beyond.  I am absolute Lord of all creation.  All glory everywhere
belongs to me.

You should reflect this glory in your daily life.  You have started well, but continue on with
obedience and passion for me.  For I am working in you, giving you both the desire and power to do
what pleases me.

Do everything without complaining or arguing, to silence your critics.  Become a peacemaker with
child-like innocence. Shine like lights in a dark, nasty, and corrupt world.  

Cling to my promises.  Then you will finish well and my full work will be accomplished in you.

Your life may end up being a simple act of sacrifice to me. But worship is ultimately an end in
itself.  Every act of worship brings glory that I deserve.

Share in the joy of authentic worship.  Don't miss out.  Joy is best when shared.

I bring people into your life to encourage and strengthen you.  You will be surrounded by those who
care nothing for my leadership.  But there will always be a few, that are like moms and dads to you.

Some people have demonstrated their quality through their constant acts of service and love.  You
should treasure these relationships and spend time with them.

As you follow me you, will grow closer to other believers. You will long for more opportunities to
spend time together.  Your destinies will be joined together in both joy and sorrow. I am leading
you both, so all your relationships are a key part of my plan for your life.

No matter what happens, true joy is found in me.  I provide consistent instruction to keep you on
the right path.  Try to stay on my path, so that my plans can develop fully within you.

Beware of evil people who wear religious masks.  My true followers have no confidence in human
effort, even when you feel justified by your own accomplishments.  You have good reason to trust in
your own performance if anyone does.

You have led a successful, orderly, and law-abiding life.  You have raised a great family, been
active in the church, and truly pursued my purpose for your life.  You have sacrificed for those you
love and tried to be good your entire life.

You once thought these things were valuable, but now you see that they are worthless in view of my
love.  In fact, nothing holds its value next to the infinite value of knowing me.

So, for my sake, discard everything else like garbage.  Do this in order to become one with
me. Don't depend on your own ability to be good or follow rules, but follow me with simple yet
unwavering trust.

You become pure by trusting in me, nothing else. Long to know me and the power that brought me back
from death.  Choose to suffer with me, so that you too can experience my dramatic resurrection power
working in you.

You have not already achieved these things or reached perfection. But keep pressing on toward the
place that I am taking you.  This is the ultimate destination that I have planned for you always.

Forget what is already behind you. Focus on the one thing that truly counts. Forget the past
failures and pain and look forward to what lies ahead. Press on to reach the end of the race.
Remember the prize that is waiting at the finish line of this life, me and my kingdom fully in you.

See also [[Prayer]]
fields.title: Letter From Jesus

* 2009 Weekly *                 -*-muse-*-

**Christmas Celebration**

We had a wonderful time this Christmas. All of the kids were here. It was great to spend time
together as a family. At the dinner table we went around the table and each person shared the two
most significant experiences of the year. Here is a brief summary of what was shared:

    Mark - experience of moving to a new house, rediscovery of a career using open-source software
    Stacie - rediscovering ministry, travel experiences
    Christine - living in Phoenix
    Josiah - bioinformatics conference and paper, buying a new car
    Sam - Pallisades festival, writing a novel
    Rachel - study abroad in Japan

**2009 in Review**

Each year amazing events transpire that shape our lives. Here is a monthly summary of the defining events for me.

* Life Budget Summary *                 -*-muse-*-

What I live for can be seen by how I spend my time
___________________________________________________________________________________________________

Work for us         $ $ $ $ $               h = five hours of personal time each week
Work for others     h h $ $ $               $ = five hours of time working to pay for it
Play with us        h h h h $
Play with others    h h h h h

          $,h    **Work**             $,h     **Play**

**Us**       10,0  Living expenses    5,5   Vacation
         10,0  Housing            0,10  Entertainment
          5,0  Savings            0,5   Personal Growth
**
Others**    5,5  Church             0,10  Family
         10,0  Tax                0,10  Friends
          0,5  Community          0,5   Writing
___________________________________________________________________________________________________

**Spending**            time   $       total
                    hours  hours   life %

**Work for us         0      25       25%**
Living expenses            10       10%
Housing                    10       10%
Saving                      5        5%

**Work for others    10      20       25%**
Tax                        10       10%
Church              5       5       10%
Community           5                5%

**Fun for us         20       5       25%**
Vacation            5       5       10%
Entertainment       5                5%
Spiritual           5                5%

**Fun with others    25       0       25%**
Family             10               10%
Friends            10               10%
Writing             5                5%

    **Weekly         50      50      100%**


**KEY ASSUMPTIONS**
Everything is measured in average hours/person
Each week has roughly 100 hours of time.  Here's how I spend them.
Work hours are allocated by the actual spending budget.
50 hours spent working/person
50 hours of liesure time/person
13.7 hours/day * 7 days = 100 hours/person
Budgeted time is for both people (eg. Social is 9 hours*2 people)
Money budget is used to convert work time to other uses.
Exchange rate = total hours worked / total budget
Each person has 5,000 hrs/year or 100 hrs/week
Combine dollar numbers $200k = 10000 hr
___________________________________________________________________________________________________

See also [[Time]]
fields.title: Life Budget Summary

fields.text:
* Invitation from God *                 -*-muse-*-

Jesus has recently invited me into a deeper with him, and I'm thinking
of saying, "yes."  As a workaholic it is totally natural to have a
performance-based relationship with God.  Instead, he wants a
connection based on love.  This is going to require a change at the
core of my psyche.  But he has agreed to walk me through this change
of attitude and behavior.

God created me with a deep desire to achieve.  In many areas this and
served me well and resulted in success.  Yet in other areas, this
disposition has thwarted my relationships.  Having to perform in not a
good basis for emotional, social, or spiritual health.

Receiving God's love changes everything!  He is inviting me into times
of rest with him,  where I don't have to do anything.  The very idea
is a little hard for me.  But the thought of having an intimate time
of enjoying the company of Jesus is something that I long for.

Change can be hard, but it is also exhilarating, at the same time.  I
long for replacing dry and lifeless service with a true connection to
the living God. In want to discard the barriers of fear that block my
most intimate relationship.  I need to see myself with open honesty as
God does.

The Lord will guide me through this transformation.  He has already
laid out a map for the journey.  He will provide companions to serve
as traveling buddies on the way.  His Spirit will do the dicey work of
surgery when needed.  I'm excited about the trip.  When do we leave?
fields.title: Invitation from God

fields.text:
* Achiever Talent *                 -*-muse-*-
A talent is a natural predisposition to function in a certain way (without thinking about it). My
dominate talent theme is Achiever. This is described as someone that derives value from
accomplishment. Every day there is a score card that lists my value. I call this a TODO list. My
worth is determined by how many items I can move to DONE. And the list never ends.

The good side of this is that I can work really hard on stuff. I go after my work with a passion and
work brings increased energy.

The dark side is that work tends to replace You in my life. I seek work for fulfillment and
satisfaction. Instead of looking to You I attempt to provide all of my needs. Help me, Lord, to see
this for the sin that it really is.

I don't want to be independent and self-sufficient. I don't want to have to wait for a tragedy to
show me that You are the one who supplies every need.

Let me see how You have created me, and let me fulfill that destiny without resorting to an
independent and panic filled striving that leads me away from You. Help me to see that You are the
one that provides everything I need.
fields.title: Achiever Talent

fields.text:
* Microplan *                 -*-muse-*-

What is a microplan?
    Series of small steps
    Simple to create and update
    Each step is meaningful
    Forcing a break-down is valuable by itself

How does it work?
    Focus on the goal
    Outline the four main objectives to get to the goal
    Break down the first objective into a series of one hour steps
    Forward motion will create momentum

When to use it?
    No goal can be achieved in a single leap
    Procratination is deadlock caused by loss of clarity
    A microplan gives a clear path forward
    Details are needed only for the first horizon

Microplanning as a strategy
    Concentrate on one path forward
    Details in later phases create planning debt
    Update plan as often as needed
    Goal, Objectives, Steps (4x4)


See also ThinkingPatterns, [[Writing]], BestPractices
fields.title: Microplan

fields.text:
* Business Practices *                 -*-muse-*-

1. **Agile** - we only do what must be done
 
 * Build incrementally
 * Act for the long-term
 * Act for the short-term
 * Delay actions until they are really needed
 * When you know what to do, act quickly
 * Everything is an experiment
 * Alter the course based on learning

2. **Trust** - we aim for life-long partnerships

 * All relationships are built on trust: clients, employees, collegues
 * Compromise profits for trust
 * Use a trust ramp to build trust over time
 * Invest in people
 * Let every action build trust
 * Eliminate low-trust relationships when necessary
 * Build a sense of community

3. **Value** - we look for 10 times ROI

 * No greater reward than creating lasting value
 * Never take short-cuts
 * Do essential tasks and stop
 * Find the biggest ROI
 * Give the client control over the project
 * Use the 80/20 rule
 * We all win together

4. **Open** - we freely share everything we can
 
 * Share your best ideas freely
 * Charge only if it requires extra effort
 * Maximize collaboration
 * Build a team of avid supporters
 * Share rewards
 * Always be inventing something news

5. **Solutions** - we solve pressing problems quickly and elegantly

 * Build simple solutions
 * Deploy the solution as quickly as possible
 * Fix problems as they appear
 * Build on a stable foundation
 * Fix the biggest problem first
 * Test every step in the process
 * Make everything repeatable

6. **Best Practices** - we do what works

 * Learn what works
 * Build a catalog of best practices
 * Combine book learning and experimentation
 * Learn from others
 * Do more of what works (experience counts)
 * Practices should be simple and universally applied


See also [[Business]], BusinessPolicies
fields.title: Business Practices

fields.text:
* Dual-boot File Sharing *                 -*-muse-*-


Sharing files with dual boot

My main computer system does a dual-boot into either Ubuntu 9.10 or
Windows 7.  This lets me take advantage of the best features of each
of these operating systems. Unfortunately, both of these operating
systems have their own file system.

 This article will show you how to set up one set of documents that
 can be accessed from both operating systems.

The solution involves creating a tree of documents on the Windows
system.  I placed these in the default directory for Windows.  On my
system, the directory c:\users\Mark\Documents\ holds the documents
for the current user.  So far, no special setup has been done.

Now for the trick.  Mount the entire Windows file system by editing
the /etc/fstab.  This file system table controls which drives are
mounted when the Linux system is booted.  On my system I added the
line

	/dev/sda1 /media/windows ntfs-g

sda1 is read as storage device A and partition 1.  Check for your
actual storage devices by listing /dev.  Create a directory for this
file system to occupy at /media/windows.  To make this change active
run sudo mount /media/windows.  If this works you will have a bunch
of files at /media/windows.

Now for the second trick.  Create a symbolic link from your home
folder to your windows file tree.  Use the following command to do
this:

	ln -s /media/windows/users/documents ~/docs

Now the files in windows are readily accessible from your home
directory at ~/docs.  There is only one copy of each file so that you
do not need to replicate anything.  

This is the perfect solution except for one issue the file system
access through the Windows file system is much slower than accessing
the files directly in the Linux file system.  Otherwise I would
consider doing the entire Linux system this way.  However, this
solution works extremely well for collections of documents that are
regularly edited in both operating environments.Sharing files with dual boot

My main computer system does a dual-boot into either Ubuntu 9.10 or
Windows 7.  This lets me take advantage of the best features of each
of these operating systems. Unfortunately, both of these operating
systems have their own file system.

 This article will show you how to set up one set of documents that
 can be accessed from both operating systems.

The solution involves creating a tree of documents on the Windows
system.  I placed these in the default directory for Windows.  On my
system, the directory c:\users\Mark\Documents\ holds the documents
for the current user.  So far, no special setup has been done.

Now for the trick.  Mount the entire Windows file system by editing
the /etc/fstab.  This file system table controls which drives are
mounted when the Linux system is booted.  On my system I added the

	/dev/sda1 /media/windows ntfs-g

sda1 is read as storage device A and partition 1.  Check for your
actual storage devices by listing /dev.  Create a directory for this
file system to occupy at /media/windows.  To make this change active
run sudo mount /media/windows.  If this works you will have a bunch
of files at /media/windows.

Now for the second trick.  Create a symbolic link from your home
folder to your windows file tree.  Use the following command to do

	ln -s /media/windows/users/documents ~/docs

Now the files in windows are readily accessible from your home
directory at ~/docs.  There is only one copy of each file so that you

This is the perfect solution except for one issue the file system

fields.text:
* When Do We Take Charge? *                 -*-muse-*-

When do we get to take charge?  After we have been following the Lord
for an extended  period (at least one month), we begin to wonder when
we get to take over.  When will be the time that we can fully be in
control. When are we licensed to operate independently.

There is something in each of us that longs to take over control of
every aspect of our lives.  We do not really like it when God directs
our steps and messes in our business.  It would be much better for him
to wait until we call for an emergency rescue.

I'm on a personal journey of relinquishing control, methodically,
systematically, and permanently.  But no matter how much I think I
have given up control, the Lord keeps touching areas that are still
unyielded. 

This is a painful process, that results in complete freedom.  The pain
ends with the surrender of each area. But the freedom lasts forever,
or at least until I reclaim the lost ground.

Yielding to God's will brings a peace of knowing that he is in
complete control.  It brings rest and healing.  If he leads us and we
can fully trust him, then we do not have any fear about the future.

See also [[Brain]]
fields.title: When Do We Take Charge?

fields.text:
* Prayer Practices *                 -*-muse-*-

Prayer is vital to spiritual formation.  I am currently experimenting
with new forms of prayer.  These are not ends in themselves, but
rather a way to encounter God.

Each practice may lead to deeper levels of personal transformation.  I
intend to seek the Lord through all possible means.  Practices that
lead me closer to God will become a part of my everyday routine.

**RestCycle**
 * daily - spend 30 minutes with God in the morning
 * nightly - when awakened in the night consciously rest in God
 * weekly - spend 3-5 in a review of spiritual growth
 * quarterly - personal retreat the last Sunday of each quarter

**[[Highlights]]**
 * select the moment of greatest closeness to God discuss it with him
 * select the worst experience and discuss that with him
 * record the events for later review

fields.text:
* First Tech Survey *                 -*-muse-*-

Summary of our experience.

We decided to refinance our mortgage through our existing lender, First Tech.  The initial
application went well, but then the app fell into a black hole, weeks went by with no progress.  We
expected to close within a few day, but the whole process took months.

The underwriters kept asking for lots of useless information causing us to have to spend a large
amount of time filing information.

The worst experience happened, when we got a letter from First Tech saying that they could not find
our insurance policy for a house we no longer owned.  The letter claimed that a new policy would be
created to cover this and we would be charged over $3000.

It is hard for me to express the level of frustration that this incompetence caused us.  Since we
had so much invested in the process already we continued through the closing.

In retrospect I seriously question the wisdom of this action.

See also [[Money]]
fields.title: First Tech Survey

fields.text:
* Google Plus *                 -*-muse-*-

Google+ is an amazing tool that can enable a whole new level of
connection with the people in your life.  Consider using it for
building a modern communication strategy.  It brings social media to
everyone without the junkie frivolity of FaceBook or the austere
restrictions of LinkedIn.

Unlike FaceBook, you can control which messages go to which circles of
people that you know.  This lets you conduct multiple separated,
threaded discussions at the same time.  You can plan an event with
people in your school while keeping your family updated without boring
anyone with unrelated info.

I've been using LinkedIn since it first debuted in 2006.  Almost no
one communicates there.  It seems to be mostly a place to post your
resume so that people can see what you are doing.  

The primary limitation of both LinkedIn and FaceBook is that you can
not segment the groups of people to interact with them.  In essence,
every conversation that you have is a wildly public conversation.
Many people are overwhelmed by a lot of discussions that they have no
interest in.

Enter Google+.  Imagine going through your contacts and dividing them
into groups based on which conversation topics they are interested
in.  Then create a social networking system around that.

It sounds like a lot of work, but Google+ has made it very easy.  This
is a system that is optimized for slapping together a group anytime
you want.

In addition, there are excellent mobile phone applications, and the web
browser works fine as well.  Put all of this together and you have a
wonderful new way to communicate.

I'm totally sold!


See also GoogleCircle, GooglePlusProject
fields.title: Google Plus

# Install using easy_install

# Or Install using pip
# pip install virtualenv

# Activate it
source django-env/bin/activate


**Second opinion**

# Install with aptitude
inst python-setuptools   
inst python-virtualenv

# Create a new virtual env
virtualenv --no-site-packages django-env

# Activate it
source django-env/bin/activate

pip install django
django-admin.py startproject myproject

cd myproject

e  settings.py
#   'ENGINE:' 'django.db.backends.sqlite3',
#   'NAME:'  'site.db', 
python manage.py syncdb


**Third opinion**

#    download virtualenv
curl -O http://pypi.python.org/packages/source/v/virtualenv/virtualenv-1.7.1.2.tar.gz

#    extract
tar xzf virtualenv-1.7.1.2.tar.gz
 
#   use the version of Python you want to run Django to install virtualenv, for example
python2.7 virtualenv-1.7.1.2/virtualenv.py --distribute ~/env
 
#   enter env in which the pip has been already installed
source ~/env/bin/activate
 
#   install packages in current env instead of polluting global space or needing sudo
#   Then Django will be installed to path like ~/env/lib/python2.7/site-packages/django.
    pip install Django
